description:
Booking.com is looking for the world’s best Front End Developers all around the globe! Join us at our beautiful headquarters in Amsterdam and work on planet Earth’s #1 accommodation website with some of the industry’s smartest people!

Our guiding principle is that by helping our users we help our business. As a Developer in the Front End team you’ll be a key part of the idea generation process, working in small startup-like teams that take full ownership of their part of our platform. You’ll work side by side with designers, back end developers, product owners, copywriters and user researchers to conceive, analyze, hand code & test your ideas. You’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of users.

Our ideal candidate has an excellent eye for detail, pragmatic approach and an absolute commitment to making sure features are well implemented and bug free. We make all of our decisions based on experiments and testing, so you should be excited by taking a data-led approach to development. If you believe you’re also a passionate advocate for the user, and are looking to work in an agile, collaborative environment than we would like to hear from you!

B.responsible

Translate requirements and mockups into fully functioning features using JavaScript and HTML/CSS Continuously look for ways to improve Booking.com and implement A/B tests Take ownership of sections of Booking.com‘s desktop, tablet and mobile web sites

B.skilled

3+ years of experience in a relevant role, preferably in a commercial environment Expert understanding of core front-end web technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS) Experience with JavaScript libraries such as JQuery Experience with templating languages Ability to write high-performance, reusable code Experience troubleshooting cross-browser compatibility issues Experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc Knowledge of version control systems Comfortable working on a command line Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal

B.offered

We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.

This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!
title: Front End/JavaScript Developer

description:
JOB OVERVIEW

The successful candidate will be technically knowledgeable and a confident communicator. The ability to communicate technical concepts in a concise and instructive manner is ideal with a passion for developing web and mobile applications. The individual should be self-motivated and comfortable working both alone and as part of a distributed team.

The role provides opportunities to work with the latest Esri technology and interact with a wide variety of customers across a range of industries including environment, government, utilities, insurance and retail. You will be problem solving on a daily basis helping to diagnose and resolve a range of technical challenges, often at an Enterprise IT level. At all times you will be delivering a world-class customer service experience and helping to grow our ambitions around customer success.

In addition, for the right candidate, there will be opportunities to work onsite with customers, supporting them in their use of GIS, and helping to demonstrate best practice.

WHAT CAN I EXPECT FROM THIS ROLE?

You will work with the Technical Research and Partner teams to:

  • Build a pipeline of appropriate UK-based startups and on-board them onto the Esri Startup Programme
  • Work with Esri Inc and other European distributors to help shape the Esri Startup Program offerings
  • Engage student, startup and professional developer communities at events in person and through social media and other online channels
  • Participate and represent Esri UK at developer events and engage the community through startup weekends, meetups, user groups and Hackathons
  • Grow relationships in the developer community in order to build contacts and relationships and influence technology choice
  • Deliver impactful technical content at events and through online channels
  • Define and create technical assets, such as reference apps, starter kits, patterns and practice guidance for use at in-person events and online

WHAT SKILLS DO I NEED?

You will ideally have a degree in Computer Science or an IT related subject, or have 3 or more years’ experience working in the IT industry with GIS or related technology. You should also have:.

  • Sound development/scripting experience and an understanding of core developer concepts such as object orientation, inheritance, modularity, as well as wider concepts such as IDEs, version control, virtualisation
  • Familiarity with the wider developer scene: hackathons, meetups, social events, etc
  • An aptitude to think creatively; identifying innovative areas to exploit the benefits of GIS
  • A creative flair for design, particularly in the arena of user interaction with web applications and other software products

description:
We're looking for developers to join us in our office in central London, developing web tools and apps for huge audiences. We are a part of the AKQA network and our clients include Google, YouTube, Skype and PayPal.

This role will see you working as part of a friendly, expert team. The workload will sometimes be hectic, but the atmosphere is cheerful and proactive. We want to put you in a position to write and deploy the best code that you can.

There are plenty of technical acronyms in here, but fundamentally we're looking for intelligent people who have an eagerness to learn new things, and the communication skills to be able to explain them to humans such as project managers and our clients.

As well as the technical knowledge, we need people that get it - people who can figure things out by themselves but know when to yell for help. Cutting down and simplifying complex problems with interfaces which make them appear straightforward.

We like to see proven abilities in...

  • Python & Django
  • Using Git (or any DVCS) to manage parallel development on a large codebase
  • Use of PaaS, such as Google App Engine, Heroku, Elastic Beanstalk, or Windows Azure
  • HTML, CSS & JavaScript

We also like talking to people who enjoy...

  • POSH (Plain Old Semantic HTML)
  • Development & consumption of HTTP APIs
  • Internationalisation
  • JavaScript frameworks & libraries such as AngularJS, Backbone.js or React
  • Google Apps & APIs
  • Scaling applications across distributed machines
  • noSQL & SQL databases

In return you'll get...

  • Free lunch, drinks and snacks

Applying

Feel free to apply with a cover letter and CV, but what we would really like to see is some code you've written. A GitHub or Bitbucket URL is ideal. Please let us know whether a freelance or fulltime position is preferable, too.

If we like what we see we'll get back to you quickly to arrange to have a cup of tea and a chat.

Potato does not currently hold a sponsorship licence therefore applicants must be eligible to work in the UK.

description:
All Roads Inc. is reshaping the way organizations manage and distribute their own unique knowledge bases through the development of an industry-changing knowledge management and online gamification SaaS platform.

Targeted at a global market expected to be worth up to $107 billion by 2016, our solution incorporates gamification to deliver a dynamic learning environment that captures, and keeps, users’ attention, motivates them forward with their education, and gives them the tools to apply their newfound knowledge.

We are seeking a talented lead developer with significant javascript expertise, project management wherewithal, and a passion for innovating, problem solving.

The successful candidate will be a key player in the development of the software and will work alongside our team of dedicated, collaborative and fun developers with ample opportunities to both learn and teach.

If you happen to love getting nerdy, brainstorming, and drinking lots of coffee (or tea), this is the place for you.

The immediate focus will be on front end development, as such the successful candidate should have the following expertise:

  • Building complex web applications and web sites using JavaScript, HTML, CSS3, and jQuery
  • Good knowledge of JSON and AJAX
  • Bootstrap experience would be an asset
  • Solving non-trivial cross-browser functional and display problems
  • Collaborating with the backend developers to integrate your work
  • Working closely with the designers to optimize the UX and design
  • Experience with relational databases and SQL
  • Moderate comfort level with PhotoShop
  • Experience developing responsive websites
  • Strong project management skills – ability to work within a timeline, manage priorities, and flag risk points
  • Organizational skills and attention to detail to keep tickets in order
  • A commitment to quality work and creating a seamless user experience
  • Experience QAing software
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

It would be great if you also have experience with:

  • Designing, building and scaling web based software
  • Frameworks such as Angular
  • Cloud computing platforms such as Azure and Amazon Web Services
  • Building and working with APIs
  • Conducting research, preparing recommendations and action plans, and developing technical documentation
  • Experience preparing development budgets and timelines
  • Experience managing projects using Agile or some similar project management framework

You’ll spend your time:

  • Building out core functionality and features, primarily in the front end
  • Brainstorming and strategizing software features and enhancements
  • Collaborating with designers, developers and product managers
  • QAing your, and other team members work
  • Learning and improving your knowledge and skillset as all great developers do

You’ll be successful if:

  • You like to create, and work with, clean code
  • You have a willingness to learn and improve
  • You hold yourself, and others accountable
  • You can organize large projects into small sprints and track team progress
  • You have the ability to adapt and roll with the punches – things change, from priorities to technology and we need people who embrace the future
  • You aren’t afraid to ask questions, admit you don’t know something, or lead the charge on finding new and better ways
  • You have a “get ‘er done” attitude and a commitment to finishing the job to the best of your ability
  • You are able to give and take feedback (positive and negative) in a way that engages others
  • You are able to troubleshoot difficult or sensitive problems and find positive solutions
  • You aren’t afraid when things break, and can keep a cool head to react and get things running again
  • You enjoy research and staying up to speed with the latest development trends and innovations

All Roads makes space for big-picture-thinkers and problems-solvers who want to create - not just manage or lead. We are a young company and we’re growing fast. Our team is comprised of people who can work well in groups, as well as independently, all while being organized. We don’t make excuses. We don’t do drama. We take ownership in our successes and failures and use every experience to build a strong, supportive workplace environment.

If this sounds like you, please apply and tell us why you’d be a great addition to our team.
title: Senior Web Developer

description:
We're making healthcare better!

Our diverse, creative team works together closely in a 2-week sprint cycle to plan, build, and test software that’s transforming healthcare. We're looking for a Full Stack Developer who’s excited about helping to create the future of patient care.

Overview

You’ll be on a high-performing team that's making a difference, and we want you to enjoy it. We'll provide a compassionate, innovative, happy place to work, and support you in your efforts to become even better. You'll work with really cool technologies, like: a multi-platform application architecture, asynchronous network software, advanced medical algorithms, clinical ontologies, and mobile platforms. Your ideas will be valued, your efforts recognized, your growth fostered, your contributions rewarded, and your successes celebrated.

Skills & Requirements

You’ll help design, deploy, and maintain a continuous delivery system for our AWS cloud-based application. This includes shaping the strategy for provisioning and managing client-specific deployments, coordinating upgrades, handling code delivery, managing environment settings, and administering data imports.

You’ll also work with clients to understand their needs and how SmartExam fits into their business strategy. This will include helping to identify ways they can take full advantage of the features of our application, working with them to integrate those features, and representing client dev ops needs internally to help shape the future of the product.

To do that, we're looking for someone who:

  • Is comfortable configuring and managing technical applications (e.g., tuning and configuring popular open source solutions, parsing application logs, using tools to analyze, profile and troubleshoot OS level issues)
  • Acts as a technical liaison between customers and internal staff, simplifying complex technical issues and convey them in a way that non-technical staff and clients will understand, and who is able to understand and manage issues, maintain relationships, and escalate problems
  • Is comfortable with Linux server configuration and Unix tools; in particular, Unix shells (e.g. Bash)
  • Can build environments with configuration management solutions, such as Ansible, Puppet and Chef
  • Can identify existing security issues and has experience handling security upgrades
  • Can create and maintain tools to support developers and operations
  • Is comfortable with version control software such as git or mercurial

These skills and experience (or their equivalent) aren’t required, but will help:

  • 1 year experience with the following:
  • Docker or other container technologies
  • Configuration management tools (Ansible is preferred)
  • Automating blue/green and canary style deployment pipelines
  • Hierarchical and distributed code repository management tools like GIT and Mercurial
  • 3 years' experience in DevOps automation for cloud-based enterprise systems, specifically AWS
  • 3 years heavy use and extending of existing PaaS in the cloud or 2 years of designing/building one's own PaaS
  • Comfort reviewing and coding in Python

You’ll likely need a BA/BS in Computer Science, or a related field, and 2-3 years of prior coding experience, but we believe that skills are more important than training. If you’ve got strong skills, but have taken a different path, we’d love to hear from you.

Cultural fit is also critical. We’re looking for someone who won’t accept mediocrity, who is open-minded, and who actively shares their ideas. You'll need both technical and communication skills, as well as a strong sense of ownership and escalation - a deep desire to see the success of our customers, and a willingness to step up at times of challenge. We want someone who will have fun, and who meshes well in an innovative, close-knit team.

There is no cookie-cutter outline for this position. If you are passionate about it and believe you could be a good fit, we want to hear from you.

A Great Place To Work

One of the hottest and most exciting startups in Portland, we’ve already been recognized as a company that's transforming how healthcare gets delivered. Our team has grown to a fantastic group of individuals who are dedicated to leading the industry into the future of healthcare delivery.

We’re glad that you’re interested in being part of a team that's driven to make a difference. At Bright.md, your ideas will be valued, your efforts recognized, your growth fostered, contributions rewarded, and successes celebrated. You’ll have the autonomy to allow your talents to shine, and we’ll provide the support you need to become even better.

We offer a great set of benefits, including employee ownership through great stock options, health insurance with premiums coverage, a very generous Health Savings Account (HSA) program, pre-tax transportation dollars, and more.

On top of that, you’ll be working with a team that knows how to have fun. We play games in the office, run company-sponsored races together, have team dinners and happy hours, go white-water rafting, hiking, and do a bunch of other really fun events and activities.

We're Already Delighting Patients And Providers

We've closed our second major round of funding, are actively implementing with some very exciting clients, and have already grown the team to a fantastic group of individuals who are dedicated to leading the industry into the future of healthcare delivery. We’re ready for you to help us grow - so come join us and help transform healthcare into what it can and should be!

Ready To Apply?

Send a resume and cover letter to Cory Dodt (cory@bright.md) , along with links to online samples of your work. Let us know why you are interested and why you are a great fit!

Bright.md is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age (if the individual is 18 years of age or older), veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For more information, please click on this link .

description:
Help O’Reilly Auto Parts build the next generation of our eCommerce websites. We are looking for an individual ready to take the next step in their career and use their experience in a rapidly growing Fortune 500 company.

An ideal candidate is an experienced web developer who is eager to work with new tools and languages. A background in Java is a great asset in this position, but an ability to learn new languages is acceptable. The Senior Software Developer is responsible for the uptime of the production environment while also contributing to application development and improvement. As part of our development team, you will be involved in the creation, improvement, and support of all eCommerce applications including our business-to-business and business-to-consumer sites and the supporting infrastructure.

This candidate can expect to work with enthusiastic, hardworking, and professional teammates. If you enjoy making quality products in a focused and evolving work environment then our Senior Software Developer opportunity is for you.

This position is eligible for remote opportunity based on skills and experience.

This position is a full time, non-contract position.

Skills and Experience:

REQUIRED:

  • 2+ years of programming experience
  • Intermediate knowledge of Project Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
  • Solid understanding of the software and system(s) supported by their team, as well as the overall company business
  • Ability to effectively multitask
  • Advanced software debugging and testing knowledge
  • Ability to understand complex computer systems (multiple programs, databases, communications etc)
  • Intermediate knowledge of programming, database systems, and systems analysis and design
  • Intermediate understanding of change management and the O’Reilly change control process and procedures
  • Ability to write advanced technical documentation
  • Advanced problem-solving skills
  • Good verbal and written communications skills
  • Must work well in a team environment,
  • Ability to learn independently
  • Willingness to work flexible schedule including nights/weekends
  • High School diploma or equivalent

description:
developer reverse engineering applications

DIGI-05-DRRQ-001-e

De regionale recherche Amsterdam zoekt een ICT-specialist die in digitale opsporing de operationele coördinatie oppakt. Het TDO vormt de pijler en de basis van het digitaal specialisme, waar de eenheid in complexe rechercheonderzoeken een beroep op kan doen. Ook ondersteunt het team de digitaal rechercheurs in de districten met specialistische kennis en/of uitrusting. Het team wordt gevormd door ICT-ers met verschillende specialisaties zoals automotive, video, internet, data analyse, mobile forensics, embedded systemen en minder courante besturingssystemen.

Functie
Als developer schrijf en ontwikkel je applicaties en houd je je bezig met reverse engineering. Je beheerst meerdere programmeertalen en je hebt ervaring met databases en het uitleren van ontwikkelde tools. Je adviseert over de toepassing van softwareontwikkeling in de opsporing. In samenspraak met de 'klant' bedenk je nieuwe softwareoplossingen. Daarnaast monitor je op het juiste gebruik en toepassing van (de door jou geschreven) software binnen de opsporing en begeleid je de implementatie van nieuwe tools. Je neemt het initiatief om netwerken op te zetten voor inhoudelijke samenwerking en je neemt je collega's mee in de wereld van apps en reverse engineering.

Profiel

  • Je hebt een hbo diploma op ICT-gebied, bij voorkeur in de specialisatie technische informatica of vergelijkbaar.
  • Je hebt ervaring op het gebied van applicatieontwikkeling en -implementatie.
  • Ook heb je gedegen ervaring met programmeertalen als C#, ASP, .NET, Java en met databases als MS SQL en/of Oracle.
  • Je hebt uitstekende sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden.
  • Je beschikt over een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk en je kunt adequaat communiceren in teams.
  • Je bent leergierig en hebt interesse om nieuwe ontwikkelingen eigen te maken.

Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Het is een fulltime (36 uur) functie in Amsterdam. De politie biedt een vaste aanstelling, waarbij een proeftijd van een jaar van toepassing is. Het bruto maandsalaris is maximaal € 4191,- (schaal 10 Bbp). De politie kent uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een 8% eindejaarsuitkering en uitgebreide mogelijkheden om je verder te ontwikkelen. Voor de benodigde opsporingsbevoegdheid en -vaardigheden volg je een interne opleiding.

Binnen het interne functiegebouw van de politie (Landelijk Functiegebouw Nederlandse Politie, LFNP) is de functie operationeel specialist B, werkterrein digitale expertise, van toepassing. Klik hier voor de volledige LFNP-functiebeschrijving.

Informatie en sollicitatie
Solliciteren kan t/m 8 mei via de link:

Klik hier voor het sollicitatieformulier!

Het selectietijdpad is als volgt:

  • Briefselectie: week 20-21
  • Vakinhoudelijke gesprekken: week 22-24
  • Assessments (1 dag): week 25-28
  • Selectie- en arbeidsvoorwaardengesprekken: week 29-33
  • Veiligheidsonderzoeken: week 34-43

Barend Frans, teamcoördinator TDO, kan je meer vertellen over de functie. Bel hem op: 06 - 51 76 53 26. Informatie over de selectieprocedure kun je krijgen via het Frontoffice Recruitment & Selectie, tel. 088 - 66 22 300.

Bijzonderheden

  • Check je digitale opsporingstalent via de online experience #crimediggers. Tijdens de sollicitatieprocedure kan de opsporingsexperience aan de orde komen, het uitspelen is niet noodzakelijk.
  • Meer informatie over de selectieprocedure en de opleiding
  • Meer informatie over de digitale recherche
  • De politie maakt werk van diversiteit. Meer hierover lees je op politie.nl.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Trefwoorden: Vacature, Fulltime, Noord-Holland, ICT-specialist, Applicatie ontwikkelaar, Software engineer.
title: developer reverse engineering applications

description:
The GitHub Technical Support team is looking for full-time team members in located in North America (US and Canada)! This person will join GitHub as part of our global support team and support our customers around the world.

GitHub users work 24/7, so you'll occasionally need to adjust your work week to help cover a weekend or holiday (don't worry! We strongly support flexible schedules that let you to take care of the important things in your life).

When GitHub users have questions, they contact Support and we help them as quickly and awesomely as possible. Technical support handles a wide variety of inquiries including questions about Git and GitHub workflows, GitHub Pages, our API, and our desktop applications. Support also works closely with the engineering team to track down bugs and improve our documentation.

The most important characteristic of our support team is that we love helping developers. GitHub is a place for people to work better, together. Our job is to help. Support treats users the way we'd want someone to treat our friends.

Our support teammates have excellent writing chops: stellar grammar, charming written personality, and the ability to explain complicated things simply. We measure our success in swiftness, accuracy, and clarity.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Current legal working authorization
  • Stellar English and grammar skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills – you might not know all the answers but you know how to find and communicate the solution
  • A strong sense of empathy – you are attuned to hear the question behind a question
  • Technical experience and exposure to programming
  • Customer service experience
  • A unique writing style and voice

BONUS:

  • Will love developers and GitHub as much as we do
  • Could effortlessly explain how Git works to a non-developer
  • Have remote customer service experience

About GitHub

WHO WE ARE

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over ten million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

We have a lot of exciting things to do, and we’re looking for the right people to grow with us!

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN

Working at GitHub is, to put it simply, a special slice of the universe. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique perspective, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed physical workspaces around that encourages you to work as you work best. Right now, over 60% of our employees are based outside of our San Francisco (SOMA) headquarters and work according to how they get their best stuff done.

Ensuring that GitHubbers are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how GitHub stays awesome. Part of this is ensuring that our benefits* are out of this world.

In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people with many different backgrounds and lifestyles, and we like it that way. We invite applications from people of all stripes. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences that people imagine to discriminate against one another. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate.

*Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask your recruiter!
title: Technical Support- North America (Remote)

description:
GitHub is looking for a full-time Business Intelligence Technology Leader to join our Business Systems team to manage, scale, and expand our Business Systems and technology.

This position offers great opportunities for teamwork, leadership, planning and career development in a fast growing company. As a BI Technology Leader, you will be responsible to manage the data needs for business functions, ensure the adoption and accuracy of existing products, and develop new BI solutions.

Using your technical skills, business acumen and creativity, you will build tools to automate reporting and generate insight that will allow GitHub users to quickly and accurately see how our key business and processes are performing. You will need to have exceptional project management, communication, and leadership skills.

We need you to be a problem solver who is creative in conceptualizing and defining innovative data opportunities; a self- starter with the ability to manage and deliver through ambiguity. You will be involved in projects from inception to delivery, ensuring that your reporting delivers high-quality and relevant data to intelligently grow our business.

You will be an important contributor and join a tight-knit environment of technical and business-minded individuals. We're a group that enjoys mastering new and sometimes difficult subject matter, strives for efficient and effective processes, and works both independently and as part of a goal-oriented team. This position is based in our San Francisco office and reports to our Head of Business Systems.

Responsibilities:

*Define and drive Corporate DW and BI strategy and execution

*Work closely with Finance, Marketing, Sales, and Product to understand their information needs, and ensuring that Corp DW/BI strategy and agreed solution is the best fit to their evolving needs

*Work with Engineering and Product Teams to help shape and drive the development of Corporate Data Warehouse

*Collaborate with leadership across all functions to drive decisions and execution plan

*Develop business requirements and technical specifications

*Define and implement strategy to empower users to leverage data through training, documentation, self service tools, or dashboards

*Be the voice of the customers

*Be a thought leader and work with the executive teams to define KPI’s

*Support continuous improvement and evaluate impact and prioritization of individual projects

*Maintain professional knowledge and skill relating to security, compliance, technology and best practices and make recommendations for process or service improvements, cost reductions and efficiencies

*Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

*7+ years of BI Technology work experience required solving problems in Sales/Marketing and Finance

*In depth experience of commercial BI tools or emerging BI technologies

*Experience working with Web-scale databases, Hadoop, or NoSQL technologies

*Strategic thinker with deep business acumen and an intuitive mind who can provide a holistic approach at integrating disparate pieces of information and synthesize recommendations

*Strong problem solving skills (critical, strategic, and evaluative thinking)

*Ability to work with all levels of stakeholders

*Excellent managerial, organizational, and analytical skills

*Comfortable working in a fast-paced, agile software development environment

*Strong written and verbal communication skills

*Ability to manage multiple priorities with focus and with the company’s strategic goals in mind

*Must be legally authorized to work in the United States

*Ability to comfortably manage confidential data

Preferred Qualifications:

*Familiarity with Salesforce.com, GoodData, Tableau, Hadoop, MySQL, Dell Boomi

*Experience working with a distributed team across timezones

*Bachelor’s degree

description:
GitHub is looking for a full-time Technical Program/Project Manager to join our Business Systems team to program manage overall business systems projects/technology and execute their successful implementation.

This position offers great opportunities for teamwork, leadership, planning and career development in a fast growing company. As a Technical Program/Project Manager, you will be responsible to work with other Business Systems managers (Lead2Order, Order2Quote, Financials, BI) to plan program deliveries, and project manage their executions successfully. You will be expected to work and collaborate with many organizations, develop new ideas of execution, recommend best practices and methodologies, help to evaluate and recommend business systems of choice, and drive the build or implementations/integration.

You'll be an important contributor and join a tight-knit environment of technical and business-minded individuals. We're a group that enjoys mastering new and sometimes difficult subject matter, strives for efficient and effective processes, and works both independently and as part of a goal-oriented team.

This position is based in our San Francisco office and reports to our Head of Business Systems.

Responsibilities:

*Work with Business Systems Managers and other leaders to develop project roadmap and delivery plan

*Coordinate internal resources to deliver business systems build, enhancement, implementation, and integration

*Ensure that all projects are delivered within time, scope, quality and cost constraints

*Assist in the definition of project success criteria and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility and desired quality

*Ensure resource availability and allocation

*Develop detailed project plans to monitor and track progress

*Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule, and project costs using appropriate verification techniques

*Measure project performance using appropriate tools and techniques

*Report and escalate to management as needed

*Successfully manage the relationship with all stakeholders

*Develop weekly customer project status reports

*Manage project issues and risks

*Develop and manage project dependencies 

*Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation

*Manage quality of all project deliverables.

Qualifications:

*This is a senior role: 10+ years of relevant software experience required, including at least 5 years in a technical Program Management or other technical team/project leadership role

*Exceptional communications, leadership and organizational skills - ability to bring people to a common understanding & reach consensus

*Deep Agile development expertise and experience, familiarity with Agile management tools

*Proven ability to manage projects of a variety of sizes and complexity – from a small one-person effort to dozens of engineers, many concurrent features, multiple development sites, very frequent releases, consistently delivering high-quality, on-time results

*Experience developing & delivering large-scale Consumer and/or large-scale Enterprise products

*Motivated self-starter with a high attention to detail; flexible and adaptable to change

*Interest in software team structure, workflow, process, tools and team dynamics to help us manage the Engineering team’s rapid growth

*Experience working at all levels of delivery; from scrumming teams to managing projects to delivering features at a program level, and can adapt leadership style based on the working teams' level of deliver experience

*Experience managing communications with external partner communications, senior management

*Must be legally authorized to work in the United States

*Ability to comfortably manage confidential data

Preferred Qualifications:

*CS, EE or equivalent Program / Project work experience

*Familiarity with SaaS platform, such as : Salesforce.com, NetSuite, or Marketing Automation Tool

*Experience working with a distributed team across timezones

*Familiarity and experience with large-scale development platforms & highly-available infrastructure/architectures supporting millions of active users – from a development, deployment, and operational viewpoint

*Awareness of best practices in Agile Development, Release Engineering & Quality Engineering

*Understanding of software life cycles with Tier 1 customers / Enterprises

description:
More and more companies are using GitHub Enterprise, so the support team is growing. When our customers have problems, they contact us and it is our goal to help them as quickly and awesomely as possible. This person will join GitHub as part of our global support team and support our customers around the world. We're looking for Enterprise Support Engineers, in North America (US and Canada) to support our GitHub Enterprise product installed and managed in the customer's virtualization environment.

Your main responsibility will be to work with our customers to solve support tickets. Tickets are usually opened by internal system administrators, and can include investigating load or networking issues, debugging application errors, and discussing feature requests. You'll also work with our engineering team to prioritize issues and development, and our documentation team to improve customer-facing resources. You don’t need to be a Git expert, but you do need to have technical experience and a passion for helping people. The position reports to an Enterprise Support Manager and works closely with other teams and leaders across the company.

GitHub works remotely and asynchronously as much as possible. While this role does not require you to live near our office, it will require some travel to meet with co-workers or attend company events.

Responsibilities:

*Solve complex customer support tickets often involving Linux servers, source code, and web application issues

*Effectively communicate technical information to customers and engineering groups at GitHub

*Work proactively with customers on activities such as coordinating upgrades, communicating upcoming features, and ensuring their installation is running smoothly

*Identify bugs and improvements in the GitHub Enterprise codebase

*Manage urgent customer outages during business hours

Qualifications:

*Must have current legal working authorizaton

*General understanding of how modern web applications work

*Prior experience providing technical support

*Excellent problem solving skills

*Familiarity with some flavor of production-level virtual machine (e.g., VMware ESX, Xen, KVM)

*Enthusiasm for working directly with customers

*Stellar English and grammar skills

Bonus points if you have:

*Worked closely with large complex customer accounts

*Familiarity with Git and GitHub

*Experience with phone support

*Ability to look through and understand code (Ruby / Bash)

*Previous experience as a System Administrator

*Previous experience as a Linux System Administrator

About GitHub

WHO WE ARE

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over ten million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

We have a lot of exciting things to do, and we’re looking for the right people to grow with us!

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN

Working at GitHub is, to put it simply, a special slice of the universe. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique perspective, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed physical workspaces around that encourages you to work as you work best. Right now, over 60% of our employees are based outside of our San Francisco (SOMA) headquarters and work according to how they get their best stuff done.

Ensuring that GitHubbers are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how GitHub stays awesome. Part of this is ensuring that our benefits* are out of this world.

In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people with many different backgrounds and lifestyles, and we like it that way. We invite applications from people of all stripes. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences that people imagine to discriminate against one another. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate.

*Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask your recruiter!

description:
GitHub is looking for full time Enterprise Support Engineers to provide Japanese-language support for our customers in Japan.

Enterprise Support Engineers support our GitHub Enterprise product, which our customers install and manage in their own virtualization environment.

At GitHub, we take support seriously, and this is not an entry-level position. As an Enterprise Support Engineer, your main responsibility will be to work with our customers in Japan to solve often highly complex support tickets. Tickets are usually opened by customer system administrators, and can include investigating load or networking issues, debugging application errors, discussing feature requests, and many other issues. You'll work with many teams at GitHub, including our engineering team to prioritize issues and development, our documentation team to improve customer-facing resources, and our sales team to guide technical conversations with potential customers.

The role is based in Japan, and requires some national and international travel.

The Enterprise Support team is distributed around the world to provide support to our customers 24 hours a day, everyday. Our team works remotely, communicating through GitHub and group chat, and several times a year we gather together to meet face to face.

You don’t need to be a Git expert, but you do need to have technical experience and a passion for helping people.

Your application should be in English, but a Japanese resumé is fine. The application process will include interviews in both English and Japanese.

You must have:

*Significant experience working with and troubleshooting Linux servers

*Enthusiasm for working directly with customers

*Ability to communicate technical information clearly

*Stellar Japanese and grammar skills

*Business level English skills

*Ability to look through and understand code (Ruby / Bash)

*Must be legally authorized to work in Japan

We'd also love you to have:

*Familiarity with some flavor of production-level virtual machine (e.g., VMware ESX, Xen, KVM)

*Experience with server automation systems like Chef or Puppet

*Familiarity with Git and GitHub

description:
The GitHub Technical Support team is looking for full-time team members located in Asia Pacific. This person will join GitHub as part of our global support team and support our customers around the world. This is the current list of countries in which we are set up as an employer in Asia Pacific, so legal working authorization is required: Japan, Australia, and New Zealand.

GitHub users work 24/7, so you'll occasionally need to adjust your work week to help cover a weekend or holiday (don't worry! We strongly support flexible schedules that let you to take care of the important things in your life).

When GitHub users have questions, they contact Support and we help them as quickly and awesomely as possible. Technical support handles a wide variety of inquiries including questions about Git and GitHub workflows, GitHub Pages, our API, and our desktop applications. Support also works closely with the engineering team to track down bugs and improve our documentation.

The most important characteristic of our support team is that we love helping developers. GitHub is a place for people to work better, together. Our job is to help. Support treats users the way we'd want someone to treat our friends.

Our support teammates have excellent writing chops: stellar grammar, charming written personality, and the ability to explain complicated things simply. We measure our success in swiftness, accuracy, and clarity.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Current legal working authorization
  • Stellar English and grammar skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills – you might not know all the answers but you know how to find and communicate the solution
  • A strong sense of empathy – you are attuned to hear the question behind a question
  • Technical experience and exposure to programming
  • Customer service experience
  • A unique writing style and voice

description:
Fragmob is a cutting edge mobile technology innovator with a focus on the Direct Selling industry. We operate more like a Silicon Valley startup than a traditional industry software provider and are looking for passionate people who love what they do. We’re growing like gangbusters, but we’re still a startup at heart. Show us your passion, your skill, your heart and your sense of humor and join the family. Fragmob offers great salaries, bonuses and benefits for world-class team members.

The Senior Android Developer Role

We are looking for a passionate and talented Senior Android Developer to join our mobile team. This is a special opportunity to be part of a team that is defining and driving the cutting edge of our latest mobile efforts.

You will work with a tight-knit team of experienced web, iOS, and Android developers, building the applications that define the Fragmob mobile experience. You will help bridge the current world of the Fragmob native app into the rich and expanding world of features we have planned. Your work will be highly visible and improve the daily lives of hundreds of thousands of our customers across the world.

Qualifications / Must Haves

  • Deep understanding of Java and the internals of Android frameworks.
  • Proficient experience with client/server networked applications (http/https).
  • Proficient with fragments and latest Android controls.
  • Excellent understanding of Android architecture patterns..
  • Adept knowledge of Android common software design patterns.
  • Experience using JavaScript in mobile applications.
  • Experience with deployment principles and procedures on the Android platform.
  • Excellent understanding of programming patterns and ability to architect elegant solutions to complex problems using abstract classes.
  • Experience with push notifications, registration, etc.
  • A natural leader, and driven to become a resource and mentor to our team.

Pluses / Nice to Have

  • Experience working with a successful Agile/Scrum team.
  • Experience with / knowledge of iOS Development.
  • Experience building modular apps and libraries versus one-off apps
  • Experience with Continuous Integration and writing build scripts

What's in it for you?

  • An exciting environment where we get to implement the great ideas we dream up
  • Work with a great team that’s disrupting an enormous industry
  • Building tools that impact the financial well-being of millions around the world
  • Competitive salary
  • Medical, dental and vision coverage (100% paid)
  • 401(k) plan + Matching
  • Great colleagues
  • San Diego office
title: Senior Android Developer
apply: Email your resume to sean.vierth@fragmob.com and tell us why you want to work at Fragmob!

description:
The merchant integration team enjoys building on the SquareTrade.com customer purchasing, pricing, categorization, and registration frameworks and web services, and implementing integrations with merchants (such as Amazon, eBay, Costco, etc.).

Our team believes in making an extraordinary impact. We do this by challenging each other to have a mindset of constant improvement, automating everything we can, thinking to scale, and wanting to do great work. Following this, our small team is able to build scalable systems to process millions of orders from some of the worlds largest merchants.

We believe that the challenges are still ahead of us. In the next year SquareTrade is expected to have major international customer growth and in order to meet the growth, we will need to add the latest technology, provide new services, and adapt our process and systems for faster iteration.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Work across the full development stack and integrate new technologies Lead the design and development of integration projects Own projects end-to-end; work with PMs on requirements, design and break down projects into tasks, set estimates and hit them Re-architect and refactor our back-end order processing system for performance and scalability Work in a fast-paced Agile environment Code. A lot of it, every day Work with partner groups; initiate discussions with partner groups when needed Be independent and self-directed Write design documents for a sub-component of a larger system, know which teams to work with to launch it, and write well-structured code without much supervision from more senior engineers

REQUIREMENTS

BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience Minimum 5 years of professional software development experience in Java based enterprise applications Strong communication skills and must be able to work effectively in cross-functional teams Opinionated, suggests ways to make things better; is always thinking about improving Be able to learn and pick up new skills and technology quickly Knowledge and experience in JEE, ORM Frameworks, SQL, and Linux

NICE-TO-HAVE

Experience with REST based web services Strong knowledge and experience with performance and scalable systems Front-end skills (HTML5, JavaScript, CSS) Able to write scripts using Bash, Python or Ruby Ecommerce, integration, EDI or retail system application know-how Someone who likes technology and keeps up with it; can suggest ways to use new technology improve our code-base Specific knowledge and experience in JPA/Hibernate, JBoss, Postgres, Spring

SOME OF THE BENEFITS OF WORKING @ SQUARETRADE INCLUDE...

Not feeling stuck! This team has exposure to many different parts of the system, making transitioning easy...we work on developing careers based on what people enjoy! Competitive salaries, benefits (medical, dental, vision), bonus opportunities, stock options, generous paid time off Respect for your work-life balance A paid volunteer day to give back to the community Company activities (from happy hours, winery trips, and picnics in the park to running a 5k) About Us: SquareTrade is the top-rated protection plan trusted by millions of happy customers and offered by top retailers including Amazon, Costco and Tesco. We have more than 200,000 fans on Facebook, consistently win industry awards and have received tens of thousands of 5-star reviews. SquareTrade is profitable, growing 90% year on year, and attracted one of the largest private capital raises in 2012, with a $238 million round led by Bain Capital. Headquartered in San Francisco and London, SquareTrade is privately held. Learn more at www.squaretrade.com

The Team: http://www.squaretrade.com/leadership
title: Senior Java Engineer, Merchant Integration

description:
We are looking for smart and dedicated Software Engineers. You will join the Merchant Integrations (MINT) team that integrates our eCommerce platform with the commerce systems of our partners, some of the world’s largest retailers. We integrate with their eCommerce, EDI and point-of-sale systems.

Our reputation with merchants is for integrating with speed, flexibility and smartness that our competitors cannot match. Our customers love us because we are better, cheaper, and because we care about them. This is an exciting position that offers autonomy and team work, with opportunities for career development.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE...

Produce high quality code and deliver to schedule Work with Program Management to review requirements, scope and timing Write technical documentation Conduct and participate in design and code reviews Take ownership of individual integrations and drive quickly to completion Enhance platform and integration technologies Contribute to product development team

REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field Experience using Java, EJB, JSP, and/or Javascript, PHP

Experience building data or API-based integrations Understanding of SOAP and REST web services Expertise with Struts 2 or other MVC framework Knowledge of XML parsing with JAXB Ecommerce, EDI or retail system application know-how Familiarity with Agile development

Not feeling stuck! This team has exposure to many different parts of the system, making transitioning easy...we work on developing careers based on what people enjoy! We have more than 225,000 fans on Facebook, consistently win industry awards and have received tens of thousands of 5-star reviews. SquareTrade is profitable, growing year on year, and attracted one of the largest private capital raises in 2012, with a $238 million round led by Bain Capital. We are disrupting the $20bn US extended warranty market with a consumer-centric offering with awesome customer service. SquareTrade is the Zappos of protection plans. Headquartered in San Francisco and London, SquareTrade is privately held.

title: Full-Stack Software Engineer

description:
The Interactive News desk at The New York Times is looking for creative, interdisciplinary thinkers with strong technical backgrounds.

About Us

Interactive News is the special digital projects team embedded within the newsroom of The New York Times. You'll be working with editors, reporters, photographers, designers and other developers to create newsroom-facing tools and reader-facing projects that expand the horizons of our digital news report.

Our department’s goal is to practice web development and software engineering as a newsroom craft. We draw on technical expertise to imagine new editorial forms. Most of our work is published in collaboration with other newsroom departments. Your role is to bring digital creativity and software expertise. Interactive News handles a mix of project types:

Early-stage experiments: You will iterate quickly and collaboratively to explore new ideas. More mature projects: You will use engineering expertise to improve the scale and repeatability of our projects. Library and tool development: You will package functionality so that it can be reused by others in the organization. About You

No journalism experience is required, but you should enjoy thinking about how to create thoughtful experiences for our readers.

You also have a strong sense of personal responsibility: You can be trusted to deliver. You take a creative approach to solving problems. You have a strong technical skillset: You can take ownership of a high-quality digital experience from start to finish. You enjoy working as part of a team but are self-disciplined when working alone. You’re comfortable jumping between details and bigger-picture challenges. If you are a member of a group that has been historically underrepresented in technology, we especially encourage you to apply. About our Tech

Ruby, Node and Python are the team’s predominant backend technologies. On the frontend, our projects are largely JavaScript (ES5+) and CSS (often SASS), with judicious use of ReactJS and similar project-appropriate libraries. Deployment, testing and maintenance of projects are shared responsibilities. We currently deploy server-side code in Docker containers to a Kubernetes cluster. You should have demonstrated experience in one of the areas above and be willing to build skills in the rest. We have both backend-focused and frontend-focused roles available. From either perspective, you ideally would be comfortable working (or eager to learn to work) across the stack. In Interactive News, we want every team member to be comfortable making changes and pushing them live to the site.

Apply!

Please provide:

Links to some work samples, e.g. sites you’ve worked on, your Github, or a portfolio site Your résumé A brief paragraph describing why you’re interested in the job and what you hope to get out of it If interested, send us a resume at newsdev-jobs@nytimes.com. This is an excluded position.
title: Interactive News Developer
apply: If interested, send us a resume at newsdev-jobs@nytimes.com.

description:
Software Engineers are responsible for building and maintaining the backbone of Civis Analytics -- the processing, automation, tooling and front-end products that create new opportunities for our clients and serve as a multiplier of the work done by our teams. As a Software Engineer, you will join our Chicago-based technology team, working collaboratively with other engineers, analysts, and data scientists to serve internal and customer needs. Software Engineers have near-endless opportunities to create new products and improve existing processes, from backend data processing to visualization and analytics tools, and we welcome your creativity. Whether you're a generalist or an expert in web apps, big data, stats, or visualization, we want to talk to you.

We are looking for individuals from a wide range of backgrounds with demonstrated quantitative and problem-solving skills. We value creativity, hard work and on-the-job-excellence and offer competitive compensation and benefits packages. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify their identity and eligibility to work in the United States.

What's great about being an engineer at Civis Analytics?

Your code will make the world a better place. Our engineers don’t just experience the thrill of solving interesting problems, they also have the satisfaction of knowing that their work makes a difference in the world. We don’t shy away from helping companies beef up their bottom line, but we also devote significant resources to projects that do good.

You will learn. Our engineers, data scientists and analysts are not only the best and brightest in their fields, but are also eager to teach and learn from you. We send our engineers to conferences and workshops they're interested in. Need software, a book, or AWS instance to help you with your work? Consider it done.

Your work will be diverse. It is not like we have just one or two problems we're trying to solve over here. Every day we're learning and working on new, cutting edge problems at the intersection of technology, data science, and practical application. Engineers at Civis have the opportunity to move around from problem to problem.

We trust our engineers. One of the perks of working with the best and brightest is that you're given the trust you deserve. Are you interested in pursuing a new way of solving an old problem? Nice -- give it a shot. Yes, you will still have a manager and deliverable, but we make a point of giving creativity the room and respect it deserves.

Your voice can change the direction of a project. We strongly encourage our engineers to participate in the brainstorming and prioritization process. We don't want people that mindlessly program. We want your perspective and experience. Challenge our assumptions, make us rethink our strategy, and help us improve our solutions. Your expertise will be a critical part of our success and you'll be recognized for your contributions.

We are smart, fun, and a little bit weird. Does this sound like you?

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related subject, or commensurate work experience
  • Working familiarity with SQL databases
  • Experience with Ruby, Python and/or web frameworks such as Rails
  • 1+ years experience as a software developer/engineer (or for recent graduates, a software development internship)
  • Love of problem-solving
  • An ability and eagerness to constantly learn and teach others

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Graduate degree in Computer Science or a related subject

Significant experience with one or more of the following:

  • Developing large web applications
  • AngularJS (and HTML/CSS/Javascript/CoffeeScript)
  • Query optimization, database administration, analytics databases, and/or NoSQL
  • Building APIs
  • Go (golang)
  • Scaling and ensuring reliability of large SaaS applications
  • Automated software testing and continuous integration
  • Cloud application deployment and monitoring
  • Using and administering Amazon Web Services (AWS) products
  • Data visualization for the web (using D3 or similar)
  • MapReduce (AWS EMR, Hive, Pig, and/or Streaming)
  • Statistics and predictive modeling (using tools like pandas, scikit-learn, NumPy, SciPy, R, STATA)
  • Political technology and data
  • Technical leadership, including leading engineering teams
title: Software Engineer (All Levels)

description:
Solution Analyst

Are you looking for a great career and rewarding future where you can make a difference to the lives of Ontarians? IT Source is a professional services organization that offers the Ontario Public Service I&IT Community a centralized and effective approach to resource acquisition. IT Source also provides enterprise wide project and portfolio management solutions and services, and Cloud solutions and services.

IT Source is looking for experienced professionals to join their team in the role of Solution Analyst. The successful candidates will be responsible for providing technical analysis, expertise, stakeholder consultation and advisory services in support of technical and project needs during the configuration and onboarding of clients onto an Enterprise Project and Portfolio Management application, Planview PPM. They will also coordinate the monitoring, reporting, analysis and oversight of IT Source technical operations with respect to service delivery models.

If this sounds like your next career move, submit your application today!

What can I expect to do in this role?

In this role you will:

  • provide on-going consultation, advice and information exchange with I&IT Clusters, vendor technical teams, specialists and clients
  • participate in all stages of the incident management, change management and problem management processes
  • conduct analysis of incident/change/problem trends and root cause analysis
  • plan, lead and coordinate performance measurement and reporting functions
  • provide strategic planning advice to management on client/vendor relations

Location: Toronto

How do I qualify?

Technical Knowledge

  • you have knowledge of IT operational support and IT service management processes and methodology (related to Incident Management, Change Management, and Problem Management), technical understanding of ITIL processes and standards, and infrastructure and application knowledge to oversee, analyze and monitor technical operations of enterprise solutions
  • you have knowledge of service delivery models of service providers/vendors including SaaS and Hybrid SaaS approaches, PaaS (Platform as a Service), cloud computing, industry trends, and systems/business analysis within a large, multi technology/stakeholder environment
  • you have knowledge of application development principles, methodologies standards, processes and products as they apply in a large information technology environment in order to assess for potential use and impact of changes within the system

Leadership, Coordination and Technical Skills

  • you can provide direction and advice to project managers, staff, and external consultants
  • you can plan, lead and coordinate performance measurement and reporting functions
  • you can make recommendations on service management related issues to a group of cross-functional technical and business resources

Communication, Consultation, and Consensus Building Skills

  • you can articulate technical options and recommendations
  • you can deliver presentations, information and training sessions
  • you can create, customize, and manage solution documents, conduct analysis, and generate reports
  • you can develop, foster and facilitate effective relationships and partnerships with managers, enterprise-wide clients and inter-disciplinary colleagues to facilitate cooperative approaches

Analyzing, Problem Solving, and Organizational Skills

  • you can review and analyze incoming incidents/requests for change or problems, assess the severity/urgency, determine action priority, and develop resolution plans
  • you can identify shortcomings and opportunities for improvement at the operational process and procedural level
  • you can conduct trend analyses and translation of outcomes that provide value to the planning and decision-making activities of the organization

Salary Range: $1,357.77 - $1,753.98 per week

Additional information:

  • 3 Temporary, duration up to 15 months, 222 Jarvis St, Toronto, Toronto Region

If you require accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us at www.gojobs.gov.on.ca/ContactUs.aspx to provide your contact information. Recruitment Services staff will contact you within 48 hours. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

The Ontario Public Service is an inclusive employer. Accommodation will be provided in accordance with Ontario’s Human Rights Code.

www.ontario.ca/careers
title: Solution Analyst

description:
Graduate Developer Position, ViaPlay

Two graduates will get the chance to enter the Viaplay Young Developer Program. The winners will, during a 12-month period, work as contributing members in 3-4 fast-paced development teams with an agenda for each area. A number of mentors will support you throughout the year. You will experience working with cutting-edge technology, and being a part of taking the platform to the next level.

The kind of qualities we are looking for in a candidate during the final interview:

  • Enjoys streaming media and has ideas how to improve it.
  • Entrepreneurial, independent, and well organized
  • “Street smart”
  • Team-player with strong communication skills
  • Development experience in Java or C#/.NET
  • Knowledge of micro-service architecture
  • Web development with React, Angular Functional programming experience e.g. in F#, LINQ, Scala, Lisp, Haskell, ML
  • Experience in cloud platforms, preferable AWS, but also Azure and Heroku
  • Interest in Behaviour Driven Development or Test Driven Development.

Applications will be accepted through Sqore.com where you will demonstrate your coding talent and submit contact information. description:
POSITION

Fusionbox is a custom software development company. We care about software design and Pythonic thinking. We're serious about supporting the open source community.

PYTHON!!

We love Python and Django. Fusionbox sponsors PyCon and DjangoCon every year, Django Girls and meet up events, and we give talks on Python and Django.

YOU

You are passionate about open source and like to try new technologies. You do not necessarily come from a traditional computer science background, but you have achieved mastery and you are particularly well suited to engineering. You are a self-starter and learn easily. You would like to get paid to write open source software.

SKILLS

  • Python expertise required and Django experience strongly preferred
  • Web Application Security, including common attacks and how to prevent them
  • Relational Database Design (PostgreSQL experience a plus)
  • Configuration Management (like Puppet or Salt)

ABOUT FUSIONBOX

Fusionbox is a software development & application security company located in Denver, Colorado. We are committed to the open source community and Pythonic design. Fusionbox is a place of learning and collaboration.

WE DO NOT USE RECRUITERS. THIS IS FOR CANDIDATES IN THE UNITED STATES ONLY -- SORRY, WE'RE UNABLE TO PROVIDE VISA SPONSORSHIP.

description:
The Role:

Join a fast moving team within the Bloomberg R&D Consumer Websites group. Our sites serve a combined 40 million+ unique users per month. In this role, you will have the opportunity to build and operate high volume web applications for Bloomberg Consumer Websites which include Bloomberg.com and Businessweek.com. We are seeking creative thinkers who bring a results-oriented approach to software delivery. As a member of this team you will be delivering continuous end-user value within a fast-paced, agile development team.

Qualifications:

  • Senior Web application developer with a minimum of 5 years of experience building high volume web applications using Node.JS, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
  • Must possess ability to take a software engineering approach to delivering front-end HTML-based software by building reusable code and libraries for future use.
  • Exposure to front-end optimization, CDNs, performance analysis and tuning for web applications - specifically Javascript is highly desired.
  • Exposure or preferably real-world experience in delivering consumer-grade high performance responsive web applications with emphasis on mobile first design methodology.
  • Successful candidates have the desire to write high quality code to build innovative web applications and the skill to handle the quirks of the Internet (and browsers and devices).
  • Strong hands-on knowledge of browser-side technology such as HTML, JavaScript (including the DOM), CSS, SVG, various image formats, HTTP, cookies, caching and security.
  • Must understand a wide variety of back end data stores and know when, why and how to use them. You should also understand how these stores interact with distributed control mechanisms and how and when they can be used to achieve high availability, disaster recovery and scaling.
  • Knowledge of software engineering practices required for working in large groups, such as software development life cycles, coding standards, test driven development, code reviews, distributed revision control systems, continuous test/build/deploy, and production systems monitoring/support.

The Company:

Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally. Bloomberg's enterprise solutions build on the company's core strength, leveraging technology to allow customers to access, integrate, distribute and manage data and information across organizations more efficiently and effectively. Through Bloomberg Law, Bloomberg Government, Bloomberg New Energy Finance and Bloomberg BNA, the company provides data, news and analytics to decision makers in industries beyond finance. And Bloomberg News, delivered through the Bloomberg Professional service, television, radio, mobile, the Internet and three magazines, Bloomberg Businessweek, Bloomberg Markets and Bloomberg Pursuits, covers the world with more than 2,400 news and multimedia professionals at more than 150 bureaus in 73 countries. Headquartered in New York, Bloomberg employs more than 15,000 people in 192 locations around the world.

description:
The Role:

Bloomberg's Infrastructure Platform group in R&D delivers services which support the fast-paced Bloomberg environment. This includes key infrastructure capabilities used across all of Bloomberg's products and services.

As a Infrastructure Platform Engineer, you will be primarily responsible for the design, maintenance and administration of the system and services built to automate our compute environment. Our enterprise uses Chef for this function and we are deploying Chef across all of Bloomberg's unique large-scale systems. Not only will your work be used by thousands of technologists at Bloomberg, but as an active open-source contributor, Bloomberg encourages you to work on projects and commit code that raises the bar for the community as a whole.

Talk to us about how you can become part of one of the newest, most technical diverse Chef installations in the industry; we have problems to challenge even the best engineers!

Technical Skills:

  • You have recent experience designing reusable infrastructure using Chef best practices.
  • You have experience with functional and object-oriented programming best practices & design patterns.
  • You have a proven track-record of building and designing reliable, scalable service-oriented web applications/services.
  • You have worked on and understand distributed systems and large scale engineering challenges.

Responsibilities:

  • You will act as a local expert in distributed systems and configuration management best practices.
  • You will build, design and maintain the platform automation infrastructure using Chef.
  • You are able to develop and evangelize sound automation practices enterprise-wide for thousands of engineers.
  • You will maintain documentation, training and SLAs for globally managed infrastructure.

Qualifications:

  • You have a minimum of 2-3 years of experience with Ruby and/or Chef.
  • You are a fast learner, capable and willing to use the right tools to get the job done.
  • You have previous experience implementing a new, large-scale configuration management & automation infrastructure.
  • You have significant experience with configuration management in a mission critical production environment.

As with any role that involves supporting a business-critical service, team members are expected to participate in providing production support in a 2nd or 3rd-level escalation capacity.

description:
The Software Infrastructure department develops the foundation on which Bloomberg developers build their applications - libraries that interface with a wide range of technologies, programmable real-time data processing pipelines, deployment systems and development tools. We are technologists who live and breathe high performance, well-factored, scalable, testable code that reacts quickly to new business initiatives.

Our developers are valued as technical experts and go-to resources throughout the company. Our users and managers are highly technical people. Within our group, all developers have responsibility for the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and coding to deployment and maintenance.

Qualifications:

We are looking for dedicated and driven software developers with strong technical and programming skills, excellent problem solving ability and appreciation for the scope and impact of their work.

The ideal candidate possesses strong knowledge of operating system fundamentals, as well as experience in the design of libraries and software systems. The candidate can expect to be writing well tested, robust, and performance critical code in a cross platform environment.

  • 3+ years of production level C++ development experience
  • 3+ years of experience with object-oriented design, data structures and algorithms

Preferred Skills

  • Multithreading experience
  • Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms
  • Linux/UNIX programming skills
  • Experience with distributed systems
  • Knowledge of Javascript, Python, or Perl
  • Knowledge of network-layer protocols (TCP/IP, PGM, etc.)

More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Ticker Plant

The Ticker Plant group is at the core of both the Bloomberg Professional Service and Enterprise Solutions products that process market data from around the world and drive the majority of downstream applications. The Ticker Plant system provides low latency processing of market data from around the world while servicing client queries from our cutting edge time series database. Our systems process billions of ticks a day and are highly fault tolerant and scalable. Our group researches and implements industry leading technologies such as high throughput time series database, low latency tick streams, and various efficient, robust and scalable components for Bloomberg's market data storage and distribution system.

Feeds Infrastructure

The Feeds Infrastructure group provides the platform that supports our feed handlers in processing market data from exchanges and contributors around the world. The platform consists of a high performance, reliable and scalable framework used to build and deploy these feed handlers and the host environment in which they run. The team provides solutions that can be reused across feed handlers to meet the market's quickly evolving demands. Our systems run 24/7 and require resiliency and seamless failover.

Feeds Infrastructure Applications

The Feeds Infrastructure Applications group builds an array of services used by feed handlers, Ticker Plant, the Enterprise product and terminal applications. The services facilitate the global distribution and processing of market data, system scalability and operational management of feeds. We solve some of the most critical feed and Ticker Plant software problems and provide the tools to manage these systems.

Data Distribution (API)

The Data Distribution group builds and maintains the largest global network in the world, spanning five continents. The infrastructure is built using state-of-the-art technologies to deliver low latency market data and news throughout the world via OpenAPI (www.openbloomberg.com/open-api). The group uses commodity software/hardware platforms to develop high performance C++ code and multithreading to achieve peak rates and optimize bandwidth and latency.

Application Framework

The Application Framework group builds the infrastructure and libraries used for developing applications at Bloomberg. This includes the application runtime environment, the UI toolkit exposed to developers, the client-side rendering engine and integration with real-time data. We are responsible for advancing the next generation of UI technology and giving our applications the advantages of the latest paradigms and features. Our group builds the tools for profiling and debugging applications and a custom IDE for developing them.

The Company:

Bloomberg's R&D department is a global team of more than 3,000 software engineers and infrastructure architects who are responsible for creating the world's premier source of real-time and historical financial market data and analytics - the iconic Bloomberg Terminal. Engineers are given the responsibility to define, architect, build, and deploy complete systems that anticipate and fulfill our clients' needs. Our agile development cycle allows us to roll out new software every day. Bloomberg has always been at the forefront of cutting-edge technology. Our teams of engineers continue to lead and drive innovation, as we have done for years.
