With a focus on technological excellence, Dreamlines strives to provide the most independent expertise and quality service to both customers and our cruise company partners. title: Software Engineer Full Stack/Node.js (m/f)

description:
Nedap is a Dutch company, based in Groenlo, with over 700 employees, but that doesn't matter that much. What really matters is that it feels small. We work in small groups, each group has their own culture and vibe. And within those groups we work in teams, so working at Nedap feels a bit like working in a small company, but with big resources. The best of both worlds.

A little over fourteen years ago Nedap healthcare was born. Founded by a spirited individual that had an eye for simplicity and a drive for success, Healthcare's first product was a small time-tracking device for nurses with a single button. Hardware has always been in Nedap's DNA, evolving in the preceding eighty plus years from mechanical to electrical devices that started to include or be connected to more and more software.

Nowadays, Nedap Healthcare builds mostly software, both for the web and mobile platforms. We help nurses, doctors, and patients manage their daily life by allowing them to focus on what is important.

We are seeking a RoR engineer to tackle a complex migration project. Our core application has been built in Java and we have been slicing it into separate parts for a while now.

Currently we have sliced away the front-end but we still rely on the Java app for most of the core data that drives the app. We retrieve this data using API calls. The next step is to access the data from within the RoR app without API calls (direct Mysql connection).

The project will entail identifying the domain logic in the Java application (with our help) and moving that logic to Rails. The first step will keep the data storage in the ‘old’ datastore and access that database from within the Rails app. As a cherry on top, the RoR app is multi-tenant, but the old core app is single tenant.

You need to be willing to temporarily re-locate to the Netherlands for the first leg of the project as you will need to interact with our engineers on the ground. After which the job can be continued remotely.

Even though this is a single shot project, if all goes well there is room for you to join our team permanently if there is a good match.

You need to have a very good grasp of Rails and Ruby but also be willing to dig into the old Java code to uncover the secret to what makes it tick.

If you are interested in helping us tackle this challenge please get in touch!
title: RoR Engineer

description:
Park Assist is looking for skilled C# .NET developers to work on our mission critical, high throughput, highly available web server application. Qualified applicants will have experience using C#, WCF, SQL Server and NUnit. This job is on-site only.

Who we are:

The engineering team at Park Assist has rescued millions of people from the mundane and aggravating experience of parking in a parking garage. We are a small, agile and energetic team of hardware and software developers who are passionate about making great products and revolutionizing an industry. We're looking for developers who can help us elevate the parking experience even further and who want to have fun in the process.

Who you are:

You are a C# developer with at least 2 years experience contributing to high throughput server applications. You have solid programming skills, an understanding of computer science fundamentals, experience with agile development practices and a steadfast belief in the value of testing. You love solving real problems and you're motivated to continuously improve how you do so.

What you will do here:

As a C# developer, you will work with a small team to improve the performance of a mission critical server application that is already deployed all over the world. You will also contribute to the design and development of the next generation server product, and assist in the migration to the new platform.

How we work:

We plan our two-week sprints in Jira, write documentation in Confluence, and basically live in HipChat. We are agile and pragmatic without being rigid. Our work hours are extremely flexible, and other than a daily 10am stand-up, we keep formal meetings to a minimum. Our technology stack consists of C#, WCF, SQL Server, Javascript, and NUnit, but above all we believe in using the best available tools for a given project.

What we are offering:

We provide competitive salary, medical, dental, vision, 401k, flexible vacation policy, whatever equipment you need to do your job well, and opportunities to attend courses and conferences. Within just a few months at Park Assist you will see your work deployed all over the world - the most gratifying reward, in our opinion. Our office is centrally located in NYC in Midtown Manhattan, near Bryant Park, Grand Central and Penn Station.
title: C# .NET Developer

description:
The Full-Stack Developer will inspire and transform students’ and schools’ exam readiness and college readiness and in doing so, will forever change a student’s trajectory towards college and career success. You will help to bring Academic Approach’s Learning and Assessment Management System to life.

You will need to be a self-starter that is confident in your coding capabilities, a creative thinker, a skilled developer, and a great communicator.

All applicants must be eligible to work within the United States.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, create, and maintain a web-based test prep and learning management system
  • Perform front-end and back-end development in PHP
  • Design, code, test, debug, and document software according to the functional requirements
  • Oversee and perform analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of errors
  • Effectively manage time to include work on multiple projects, tight deadlines, and prioritize assignments as necessary

Experience and Skills Required

  • 3+ years of experience using PHP to build dynamic web based products
  • Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or related field or the equivalent level of experience
  • Demonstrated experience and proficiency in all phases of planning, developing, and maintaining back-end and front-end systems
  • Great communication skills and demonstrated ability to work with others in a team environment

Experience and Skills Preferred

  • You can easily translate a product vision and feedback into your work product
  • You have experience working with secure data
  • Proven ability and experience with PHP Framework Laravel
  • Experience using Git for version control
  • Experience with AWS hosting platform
  • You enjoy interesting and complex problems that require innovation and creative thinking to solve
  • You have experience working on products that target the education industry

Location and Work Environment Candidates must be willing to work in Chicago, IL at our office in the Lincoln Park neighborhood, very close to great restaurants, parks, and public transportation. Our work environment is collaborative, creative, and filled with passionate people working to improve educational outcomes for schools and students.

Compensation Academic Approach seeks to hire the best and brightest person for the job. We offer health insurance and competitive wages, which are commensurate with experience and skills.

Equal Opportunity Academic Approach is an equal opportunity employer.

Application Process All applicants must be eligible to work within the United States. The application process will include a resume review, phone interview, and in-person interviews. Background and reference checks will be conducted on all prospective new hires. To be considered, please submit your resume and cover letter to Hiring@academicapproach.com.

About Academic Approach

Let’s be honest: tests are standardized; however, students are not. No two students share the same academic strengths, learning style, or personality.

At Academic Approach, we are driven by one mission: to academically support students, families, and school leaders in this ever-changing, never-boring, always thrilling assessment landscape. Academic Approach works closely with families and schools to understand each student, identify his or her specific gaps in knowledge, and customize the most effective test preparation and college readiness solution.

An Academic Approach Type of Person

We are looking for motivated individuals ready to make a massive difference in education and work in a collaborative and fast paced environment. Our organizational culture is shaped for those with the following traits:

Innovator: We understand that all great things start with a groundbreaking idea and are followed with diligent and collaborative execution and insight.

Explorer: We relentlessly pursue the knowledge needed to shape and influence student and school performance.

Problem-Solver: We are dedicated to finding concrete and actionable solutions to the education challenges facing students. We embrace difficulties with optimism and team work.

Organizer: We prioritize all of our activities around what’s best for students and schools and organize our activities to turn great ideas into reality.

Builder: We are committed to the success of the mission. We believe nothing should be done without purpose and a focus on the future.

description:
If you are extreme in your attention to detail and live to ship quality software, we want to hear from you. HelloSign is hiring a detail oriented QA Engineer with an outstanding attitude to join our team and rock the quality of our eSignature platform. The ideal person will have 2-5 years experience in QA Engineering and be comfortable with REST API test cases, manual testing and writing code. This role is key to building out an effective QA function so we can scale. We look forward to your contribution.

Responsibilities include:

  • Documenting/executing test cases (Functional and API) in the test management tool, based on system understanding and analysis of functional specifications.
  • Working with product managers and developers to understand business requirements and perform test effort estimation/documentation, for features and/or bugs.
  • Identifies test data requirements and generates required test data with the help of developers/product team.
  • Coding automated flows (Java preferred, but just about any language is fine).
  • Identifying high-risk interactions and flows that need extra testing.
  • Documenting bugs in Jira.
  • Performing Regression & Sanity testing in a release cycle.
  • Actively participating in daily scrum calls.

Qualifications:

  • Experience: 2-5 years in Quality Assurance or Quality Engineering for a web-based product.
  • Self-motivated: We absolutely value self-motivation! This not only helps you grow but us as well. In other words, we are there to support and encourage you, but the true motivation should come from within you.
  • Team work: You'll need to work alongside our engineers and product managers. Collaboration is important to us and we believe in leaving our egos at the door.
  • User-centric: You need to put yourself in our users' shoes. Even if something isn't technically a bug, if it's a pain from the user's perspective then it’s something we should be aware of.
  • Flexibility: Sometimes, you might have to wear multiple hats in a day - from documenting functional test cases, switching to API tests and even coding automation.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with a good command of the English language.
  • Extreme attention to detail.
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Good knowledge of SQL and Relational Databases.
  • Knowledge/Experience in commercial and/or open-source test automation tools.
  • Familiar with Web technologies (PHP, Python, Javascript, HTML, JSON, etc.).
  • Good understanding of the software development lifecycle and Agile approaches.
  • Bonus points for past coding experience.
  • And last but not least, a positive attitude!

About us:

HelloSign is a leading provider of eSignatures, allowing users to sign documents when, where, and how they want, all with the most intuitive user-interface in the industry. We’ve seen tremendous growth and now we're taking it to the next level by launching a fully featured API that allows clients to integrate our eSignature functionality directly into their own website.

We’ve got backing from some of the top investors in the valley, including Y Combinator, Greylock, Google Ventures, and US Venture Partners. We’ve seen tremendous growth through word-of-mouth alone and now we're taking it to the next level by launching a fully featured API, building deep integrations in other products (gmail, box, evernote, google docs), enhancing our web-application with cutting edge technology (like React.js) and building an innovative mobile-first solution. Our goal is simply to be the way people sign documents everywhere.

HelloSign is centrally located in the Union Square neighborhood of San Francisco. We are a fun, and creative start-up made up of 40+ employees, so not too small and not too big! We recently received the amazing employee culture lifestyle award from Hirepalooza. Also, check us out on TheMuse and Glassdoor!

Life at HelloSign:

We have raving fans who love what we make • We're user-focused and product-driven • We're always evolving with an eye towards improvement • Committed to building a product people want • We have a well-defined culture of fun, continual learning and collaboration • A supportive, familial atmosphere • An open, airy, creative space with communal dining and lounge spaces • We love dogs • Happy hour for unwinding and partaking in shenanigans • A fully stocked kitchen with drinks and snacks • And we'll never forget your birthday!
title: QA Engineer

description:
(No recruitment agencies please.)

We are looking for an enthusiastic, smart and personable Junior developer to join our software team.

You will be primarily working on projects to support our Java backend systems such as parsing, loading and normalising data sets, and improving the microservices which generate reports for our users. If you’re familiar with HTML/CSS/Javascript then this is a bonus, but initially your main role will be backend development.

We’re technology agnostic and try to use the right language for the right job: Java 8 for critical business logic, Python 3 for scripting, machine learning and data processing and Javascript (React) for front end. We don’t expect you to know all of these of course - just commercial experience with either Java or Python.

We have a strong engineering culture and a “20% off-plan” policy (where everyone works one day a week on pet projects, ideas and other non core tasks). This has produced some of the most popular user features in our software and allowed us to adopt new technologies (such as Docker).

We use Agile methodology, have regular learning lunches, decent coffee, iMacs for all and we’re a friendly team.

This is an amazing chance to work with cutting edge technologies, get mentorship from experienced engineers, and work on an interesting variety of projects. We’re looking for a team player who has the right attitude, good fundamentals of Computer Science or Software Engineering, and a willingness to learn.

Skills & Requirements

  • 1+ years of commercial experience of at least one of Java, Python.
  • At least a 2:1 or equivalent degree in relevant subject (Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar)
  • Enthusiasm, good team player and willingness to get involved in many different projects
  • A right to work in the UK

About Us

Aistemos is a tech start-up based in the heart of London. We’re here to help businesses make the most of their Intellectual Property, which has become an integral part of any commercial strategy, with a world-class team that brings together the very best of IP and data science. Cipher, our core product, is a SaaS data analytics web-application that has been developed together with over 100 companies, including major investments banks, accountancy firms, law firms and major corporations. Since our launch a year ago, we’ve built some brilliant relationships with some of the world’s leading businesses including BAE Systems, Ocado and ARM.

Our stack is based on Linux running on AWS. We have analytical microservices in Python 3 (Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn) and data manipulation in Java 8 (Dropwizard, Gradle, Immutables). The user interface is build in Javascript (React, Less, npm, D3). We believe strongly in code reviews, unit testing and agile development.
title: Junior/Mid Level Software Engineer

description:
Company Description

Texture is the modern magazine experience. A single platform where you can read your favorite magazines - anywhere, anytime - on your preferred digital devices. More than just standard magazine ported into pixels, Texture brings a new magazine experience to bear through digital and audio extras and a modern UX that transforms two-dimensional print vehicles into multi-sensory digital experiences, all while maintaining the classic editorial quality one expects from the top editorial brands in the world.

Since Texture is owned by the major publishing houses including Time Inc, Conde Nast, Hearst, Meredith and Rogers Inc, Texture is the only place where readers can get universal and unlimited access to the best editorial properties for one low monthly price. For the same cost as 2-3 magazines at the newsstand Texture readers enjoy unlimited access to over 175 of the most popular magazine brands, including their back issues. Respected reading has returned.

Job Description

Texture has an exciting opportunity in our Technical Operations team for a self motivated, energetic and tenacious DevOps Engineer who is enthusiastic about systems reliability, automation and scaling. The Technical Operations team operates and maintains the services that provide digital magazine content to our end users with a 99.99% uptime requirement. Your results oriented aggressiveness will help in managing our rapidly growing LAMP servers on private and public cloud infrastructure.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and manage cloud services networks and infrastructure.

  • Provision managed services and associated products to customers.

  • Automate everything: Work with operations, QA and engineering teams to automate management and orchestration tasks, streamline processes and reduce manual administration functions.

  • Monitor system performance and availability, make recommendations to improve and implement system wide changes to enhance overall system proficiency.

  • Assist in formulating security mechanisms to prevent, detect & respond to internal and external security threats.

  • Handle production support issues as they arise, performing triage, debugging and remediation steps to maintain availability goals. Participate in a 24/7 on-call rotation. Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent discipline.

  • 3+ years administering and managing Linux systems and RESTful services in a production environment.

  • Solid understanding of Linux distributions including CentOS, Ubuntu or equivalent.

  • Experience with configuration management and deployment tools (AWS CloudFormation Templates & CodeDeploy, Ansible, Puppet, etc.).

  • Background in using revision control systems (SVN, Git); network management tools (Zabbix, Nagios, Zenoss); communication tools (wikis, issue trackers).

  • Well practiced configuring, deploying and managing a clustered application stack in public clouds such as Amazon Web Services (AWS).

  • Strong scripting skills with a variety of languages including Python and bash.

  • Experience with configuring and maintaining common infrastructure components such as Apache, nginx, memcached, NFS, DHCP, DNS, SNMP or similar.

  • Strong, creative problem solving and analytical skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team with excellent written and oral communication skills. Handle pressure-filled situations in a professional, responsive manner.

Nice to have:

  • Setup and operation of PostgreSQL or MySQL database experience including basic administration tasks.

  • Setup and operation of NoSQL databases (Cassandra, MongoDB & DynamoDB) and Hadoop clusters (Apache, Cloudera, MapR, etc.)

Additional Information

Texture, by Next Issue, is a digital magazine platform owned by Condé Nast, Hearst Magazines, KKR, Meredith, News Corp, Rogers Media and Time Inc. It's a completely new way for readers to experience the world’s best magazines, reimagined for how people consume content today.

Texture combines everything readers know and love about the print magazine experience and layers onto it the power of digital—giving people a curated reading experience that's available anytime, anywhere.

If you love magazines and want to be a part of a company that is revolutionizing the digital space, please apply!

description:
POSITION DESCRIPTION

The Web Developer for the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching’s Collaborative Technology team will work collaboratively with the Collaborative Technology (Co-Tech) and Analytics teams, as well as with staff, partners and consultants, as appropriate and as needed.

POSITION PURPOSE

Co-Tech is a specialized technical team that provides Foundation-wide support for a variety of technology tasks, including the conceptualization, design, prototyping, testing, and implementation of various web applications, software, mobile applications, and collaborative tools. The Team develops various products to support the Foundation’s Community College Pathways (CCP) work and its Student Agency Improvement Community (SAIC) work, as well as a wide range of External Offerings and Partnerships (XoP) — from the ideation phase all the way through prototyping, testing, and refinement to completion. The technology team relies heavily on the principles of improvement science and design-based engineering and development thinking to guide its work. The Web Developer is an integral member of this team.

The Carnegie Foundation will consider hiring a Web Developer at the Senior level if the candidate’s accomplishments, experience, and education warrant a Senior level placement.

Classification: Full-time, Non-Exempt Reports to: Director of Collaborative Technology

The Web Developer will be responsible for the development of technology solutions addressing needs such as developing:

Platforms for collaborative work among distributed networks Portals for capturing, organizing, and sharing results Dashboards for educational longitudinal data Duties include, but are not limited to:

PRIMARY DUTIES

Design and develop rich, innovative systems (from concept to completion), web applications, stand-alone systems, and collaborative tools supporting the Foundation’s internal operations, our substantive program areas, and our external partners using PHP, and Python Design, develop, and maintain MySQL databases Write and maintain JavaScript to support the Foundation’s numerous websites Support the ongoing development and maintenance of several content and learning management systems, including legacy systems Produce and maintain complete and clear documentation of all projects on a timely basis

OTHER DUTIES

Learn and apply the principles of improvement science to various aspects of the work Conduct research and review of leading edge web design and development techniques and tools, communicate findings to teams, and apply new knowledge to the work Create frontend design, wireframes, prototypes to support a formal design process On a project basis, lead the design process and manage interactions across teams Present on project goals, status, and outcomes to members of the Foundation Summarize and compile information into reports for internal users Assist with technical support duties and other duties as assigned Summary of Qualifications The ideal candidate will have an interest in the educational application of emerging technologies, extensive experience in web application design and development, and extensive experience working with content and learning management systems.

EDUCATION

A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science with an emphasis on Human Computer Interaction or equivalent experience is strongly preferred.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience building, testing, and deploying high quality, highly reliable web applications and user interfaces in a team environment Current Python and PHP experience Experience collaborating with designers and server-side engineers Experience working in a LAMP & open source environment Verifiable experience in creating technical design specifications and translating user stories to production code Expertise with (X)HTML, CSS, JavaScript (jQuery) & AJAX Knowledge of frontend development frameworks such as Bootstrap Knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and responsive design Knowledge of MySQL and relational database environments knowledge of NoSQL database environments, including Google Datastore Familiarity with lean/agile software development methods and practices Strong interpersonal and communication skills Ability to work well as part of a team to move the entire organization forward DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS

Familiarity with supporting and developing around Google Apps. Experience with Google APIs: Google Apps Application APIs (Drive API, Spreadsheets APIs, etc.) Google Identity Toolkit API, Google OAuth2 API, Google+ API, Google+ Domains API is highly desired and an added advantage. Experience developing for Google Cloud Platform, particularly Google App Engine. Knowledge of user interface design, HCI (e.g., Fitts’ Law, minimalism), design thinking, and a deep interest in and substantive knowledge of current design trends. Demonstrated passion for and commitment to creating a flawless and continually improving UI/UX experience. Fluency in Photoshop. Experience with R/LaTeX. Strong conceptual and writing skills, particularly writing to explain technical concepts and procedures to non-technical audiences. Interest or experience working in the field of education improvement. About the Carnegie Foundation Founded by Andrew Carnegie in 1905 and chartered in 1906 by an act of Congress, the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching is an independent policy and research center engaged in a wide range of activities and research to support and advance the work of educators at all levels. Following the appointment in 2008 of Anthony Bryk as the Foundation’s 9th president, the Foundation has undergone a significant transition in its program of work. The new focus seeks to pioneer a radically different model of educational research and development capable of advancing improvements in student learning at scale.

THE WORKING ENVIRONMENT

The Foundation offers a collaborative, community-building atmosphere grounded in an environment of mutual respect. The facility itself is located in Stanford, California in a quiet pastoral setting near a hiking trail. Amenities include a communal kitchen (coffee, tea, and drinks provided), outdoor eating/gathering areas, and free parking.

SALARY & BENEFITS OFFERED

The Carnegie Foundation offers a wonderful and positive team oriented work environment, a competitive starting base salary depending on your experience level, plus a comprehensive and generous benefits package, including: three to four weeks of vacation your first year; ten paid holidays off plus the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day off as a holiday week; up to twelve days of sick leave annually; full 100% employer paid medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees; life, disability, and long term care insurances; a 403b plan with generous matching provisions; matching charitable contributions; free onsite weekly yoga/fitness classes; free parking, plus other Foundation benefits.
title: Web Developer, Collaborative Technologies
apply:
Review of applications will begin immediately, and the position will remain open until filled.

To apply, please refer to the job title in the subject line of your email. Please email your resume to resumes@carnegiefoundation.org and include salary expectations and a detailed cover letter explaining why you are interested in this position and how your strengths and skills would contribute to Carnegie’s work. Carnegie does not provide visa sponsorship at this time. Relocation assistance provided.

description:
Senior Java Developer Job Description

Tech 2000 is a fast-growing, exciting global leader in technology training and software application development. Tech 2000 is committed to pushing the boundaries of technology and innovation to enhance the learning experience and support those who are energized by education. We are intensely focused on supporting our client’s educational needs in order to improve their businesses and meet their organizational goals. Education and educational tools is our business – and our passion.

Based in Herndon, VA, Tech 2000 is a Cisco Learning Solutions Partner, an exclusive Apple Authorized Training Center in 3 markets, and a MEF Training partner. Our core strengths include content development, mobility, dynamic education tools, and training delivery for IT such as Apple OS X and Pro Apps, Cisco certification, Metro Ethernet, Sales enablement and business skills. Tech 2000 was recently named one of the "50 on Fire" companies in the Washington, DC region by In The Capital, and has won the Cisco “Innovation Partner of the Year” award for each of the last 5 years for the leading edge technologies we have developed.

Our team members are client oriented and tech-savvy. They have a "can-do" attitude, embrace change, enjoy a fast-paced working environment and have a keen sense of urgency.

The Job

Sr. Java Developer

Tech 2000 is seeking an experienced Sr. Java Developer with active CCIE or equivalent hands-on Cisco Networking experience, to work on a Global Bootcamp Team to drive adoption of new technologies, impacting technical support engineers worldwide. This is a full-time 18/mo contract-to-hire position for local candidates only.

Overview -The application is NOT interfacing with or accessing actual Cisco equipment. -The application is using simulated devices that are expected to function as an actual Cisco device within the simulator. -The developer will NOT be creating or accessing APIs in any manner. -The developer will be responsible for creating code to emulate many network protocols and technologies to simulate the functions and operation of Cisco equipment. -The developer will be designing and creating simulated Cisco devices in code that emulate an actual Cisco device. -The developer must have substantial experience with the real life Cisco products and technologies that they will then be creating as simulations in the application.

The Qualifications

Required Skills: Cisco CCIE or equivalent real world hands on experience with designing networks and configuring Cisco networking equipment.

  • Nexus and MDS product line
  • IOS router and switch product line
  • IOS XR
  • Strong understanding of networking fundamentals and protocols including but not limited to:
  • Spanning Tree
  • MAC address tables
  • ARP
  • HSRP
  • OSPF
  • EIGRP
  • VRF
  • Port-Channels and vPC
  • Nexus VDC and FEX
  • VLAN and Trunks
  • Fiber Channel

Nice to have but not required:

  • MySQL experience
  • ASA firewall experience
  • Metro Ethernet switches
  • VMware
  • Nexus 1000V

Minimum Qualifications: Requires a BA/BS degree or 7-10 years industry experience. CCIE or equivalent experience Seasoned programmer with extensive experience designing and building Java applications

We do NOT accept replies from recruiters or third parties.

Candidates must be eligible to work in the US for 18 months- we can not sponsor you.

Reply to recruiting@t2000inc.com, no phone calls please.
title: Senior Java Developer

description:
About The Position

ToyTalk is seeking a passionate application software engineer to advance our professional-grade authoring tools for building conversational applications. 

We are advancing the field of computer conversation by creating engaging characters that talk with users using text or voice inputs, artificial intelligence, and character animation. As part of this effort, we have built a powerful content authoring system for nontechnical teams to craft conversational experiences, called PullString. This desktop authoring environment is written in Python and PyQt, binds to several internal C++ APIs, and is deployed on Mac OS X and Windows. You should therefore have experience delivering professional GUI applications based on these technologies.

In addition to working within a group of strong software engineers, you will be working closely with teams of creative artists who use our content authoring tools to build conversational characters. You should therefore be comfortable working with both technical and non-technical colleagues. 

About ToyTalk

ToyTalk is a company with amazingly talented people trying to tackle a pretty radical idea. We are a family entertainment company with a mission to create entertainment powered by characters and computer conversation. We've released several conversational mobile apps, including The Winston Show, SpeakaZoo, and SpeakaLegend. Through our partnership with Mattel, we released a conversational app featuring Thomas the Tank Engine as well as a physical Barbie doll that you can talk to using ToyTalk's conversational technology. We are now starting to expand beyond the kids entertainment market to build more complex conversational experiences for all ages.

ToyTalk is a venture backed start-up in the heart of San Francisco. We offer competitive salaries, stock options, and a comprehensive benefits package.
title: Desktop Application Developer

description:
Our Site Reliability Engineer will help build the best database management service for the leading document database server in the world. MongoDB’s Cloud Management service runs databases holding petabytes of data and processes over a billion metrics and tens of billions of backup operations every day. But we have barely begun. In the future, our online database service will auto-scale, self-heal and hide nearly all of the complexity of running a large scalable system.

Responsibilities

  • Manage the infrastructure for a cloud service that processes a billion metrics per day, and replicates tens of billions of database writes to our backup service
  • Design, implement, operate and troubleshoot the automation and monitoring of a service that seamlessly spans several data centers and several cloud providers
  • Become an expert in MongoDB performance, helping us optimize from the application level all the way through the firmware
  • Participate in a weekly on-call rotation, and make trips to our data centers as needed
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues in multiple environments
  • Improve our infrastructure capabilities, optimizing for cost, simplicity, and maintainability

Requirements

  • You are passionate about the revolution going on in information technology as core services migrate to the cloud
  • You have experience running a mission critical service at scale
  • A working knowledge of information security issues
  • Prior experience as a systems administrator in a Linux environment
  • Firm grasp of at least one modern programming language, beyond basic scripting
  • Solid experience using configuration management frameworks (e.g. Chef, Puppet)
  • Working knowledge of web and network protocols and standards (HTTP, TLS, DNS, etc)
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Experience with Amazon Web Services

Nice to haves

  • Experience building large applications from scratch, complete with deployment tools
  • Experience writing automation tools & eagerness to "automate all the things"
  • Experience in networking, security, hardware or OS performance tuning
  • Experience with Google Compute, Microsoft Azure and other cloud services

description:
About Us

OpenTrons makes lab robots for biologists and software for designing and sharing experiments. We’re taking on the highly centralized, closed biotech tools industry with an open, affordable automation platform built for sharing and collaboration.

The OT-One is the world’s first personal pipetting robot. Current biology robots are like mainframe computers -- tens of thousands of dollars and require expert programming to run. The OT-One starts at three-thousand dollars and lets you download experiments like you download an iPhone app. We have users around the world in all types of labs including prestigious academic institutions, cutting-edge biotech start-ups, big pharma, and community hackerspaces.

We’re making the tools people will use to usher in the next generation of biological technology. Tools to make new forms of bio-materials, bio-devices, and bio-art. To make new discoveries. To provide the whole population with healthy food. Tools to cure every disease.

We are a Y Combinator and Khosla Ventures backed startup looking for amazing people to join our team. Please contact us if you share our passion for empowering people to innovate with biotechnolgy and want to contribute your skills to developing our open robotic lab platform.

About the Position

We're looking for Rails developers to help us build Mix.Bio, a new way for scientists to design, share, and collaborate on automated scientific experiments.

Senior Developers should be able to rapidly execute on new feature requests and provide guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and strive to increase the quality of the entire team's work.

About You

You have at least two years of production Rails app experience, with stories to tell.

You're familiar with test-driven development in a production environment as well as Agile (Scrum) workflows.

You know where Ruby ends and Rails begins. While you enjoy the convenience of Rails, you can roll your own app and have done things beyond just websites.

You're familiar with REST, but aren't tied to it.

You understand the internals of the libraries you use. You can explain Rack middleware, ActiveRecord, the flow of a web request from raw HTTP all the way to a displayed website, and know your GETs from your POSTs.

While gems and fancy JavaScript frameworks are nice, you have no problem getting your hands dirty and writing your own custom code to tackle complex problems.

You've preferably written your own gems or libraries in other languages.

You understand Web essentials, such as the HTTP protocol, SSL, cross-site scripting, and SQL injections.

You write awesome code and can fluently spot security and design flaws in the code of others.

You're able to guide junior engineers not only to achieve the current sprint goals but to enable their progress as developers.

You can take a feature requests and own it, making sure it's completed quickly and above expectations.

Required Experience

  • Two to five years on production web apps
  • Two years of production Rails experience
  • Full-stack experience (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)

Required Skills

  • Ruby
  • Ruby on Rails
  • SQL/NoSQL
  • CSS3 (we use Sass)
  • Vanilla JavaScript
  • Basic Web Security
  • Git

Bonus Skills

  • Regex
  • Docker
  • Ansible
  • nginx
  • Postgres
  • Sinatra
  • Cloud Deployment
  • Continuous Integration
  • Agile Methodologies (Scrum)
title: Senior Rails Developer

description:
We’re looking for a developer who wants to build software that transforms the way public radio delivers its core asset - audio.

Some of the biggest names in public radio - NPR, KPCC, WNYC and WHYY - are partnering to build a system that simplifies the workflow and delivery of on-demand and podcast audio. Our goal is to create the platform that many public radio stations use to power their digital audio operations. If you love podcasts and public radio, this is a unique opportunity to have an impact on the future of the industry.

As an audio-focused Applications Developer on this project, you'll be responsible for building the core systems and services around on-demand audio upload, management and delivery. You will work as a part of KPCC's small, dedicated product team. Our mission is to build durable platforms for publishing journalism, give audiences new ways to interact with audio (both streaming and podcasting), and help public radio build new digital revenue models.

We do a lot of cool stuff with audio tech, and you’ll take ownership of the audio management parts of our codebase. Most of our software is built on Rails, Node.js, and the Elastic stack.

How we work

At KPCC, developers work alongside designers and product managers as part of a unified team, and there's shared ownership over the direction of our products . We are strong believers in tests and continuous integration. All of our code is hosted on Github, and your work on this project will be open sourced for the benefit of the public radio and podcast ecosystem.

We use Slack to stay connected to each other, our code and our systems. We build iteratively and ship often, but also strongly value software quality. We’re a hardworking team who sets ambitious goals.

Why KPCC

KPCC is trying to redefine how public service journalism can serve a diverse metropolis. KPCC is part of Southern California Public Radio, a member-supported public media organization. We reach more than 700,000 listeners every week, and over 1 million people with our digital products. We've partnered with NPR, WNYC and WHYY on a two-year project to apply our collective knowledge around digital audio to build tools that will benefit the entire public radio system.

You’ll come in every day and work on meaningful challenges and interesting apps with a crew of smart, friendly, creative people. You’ll get to work in a small, fast-moving team that has a big impact on the future of public radio. You can come to work at the Mohn Broadcast Center, our beautiful office in the heart of sunny Pasadena, but we're also remote-friendly. We offer competitive benefits and salary, a true life/work balance, and support a diverse and inclusive work environment.

How to Apply

To apply online, please follow this link: https://americanpublicmedia.applicantpro.com/jobs/338697.html
title: Applications Developer (Audio)

description:
Noom's scientifically proven behavior change programs take the uncertainty out of creating a healthier lifestyle, reliably delivering health outcomes, and we are tackling some of the biggest diseases out there (Type-II Diabetes, Obesity, and Hypertension to name a few). Our Engineering and Support teams are at the forefront of this challenge, solving complex technical and UX problems that center around habits, behavior, and lifestyle.

As a Test Engineer at Noom, you will be working with the Director of QA and be embedded into our Engineering and Support teams, leveraging your aptitude in high-quality testing methodologies and tools to influence better software/product design and proper engineering practices. You will write automated and manual test cases, implement test scripts, and research the latest and greatest testing tools with a critical eye, deciding which tools would best suite Noom. You will be contributing to the development of our automated testing architecture, and participate in bug identification and triage with the Support team. You will dig through the code base and break things, identifying weak spots, and be creative in figuring out how we can make it better.

description:
Join our dynamic team of innovators hard at work building the future of education. From our studios in Seattle and San Francisco, we make it possible for people everywhere to learn what they want and do what they love.

Founded with the belief that world-class education can (and should) be available to everyone, CreativeLive connects photographers, crafters, musicians, and entrepreneurs of all walks of life with top-notch learning from industry leaders. Whether a weekend warrior or the newly full-time freelancer, CreativeLive gives students the tools and the encouragement to make it happen, whatever "it" might be for them.

CreativeLive is looking for talented senior data engineers to join our growing technical team in our San Francisco studio. You will helping to forge new frontiers in learning applications by extending and supporting our data processing pipeline. 

Our runtime platform is built on Node.js and Angular.js, and the ideal candidate will be excited about integrating their strong data engineering skills with an end-to-end JavaScript stack (with occasional forays into Python, Java, R, Golang, bash, etc).  Our current data engineering efforts are focused on building systems to capture runtime data in Mongo and a firehose of real-time events in Kafka via stream processing and ETL to Redshift, to support our growth team, business analysts, and our accounting department.   Although this position is focused on data engineering, we are particularly interested in candidates that will **fearlessly venture beyond the bounds of the data tier** to instrument and optimize related code in the runtime stack.

Along with your fellow engineers, you'll be working to continuously improve the CreativeLive platform by:

  • iterating on prototypes
  • architecting modules and applications
  • improving and extending the runtime database architecture
  • adding client-side and server-side analytics hooks to the runtime stack
  • implementing data visualization dashboards
  • supporting a variety of third-party analytics and marketing tool integrations
  • interfacing with (and creating) web services 
  • improving the scalability and fault tolerance of our distributed systems
  • actively contributing to refining our Agile development processes

Some of the things that would make you a great fit for our team:

  • You embody creativity, positivity, and exploration, and are inspired by our mission.
  • You are an active contributor in the technical community.
  • You care deeply about code quality, performance and execution.
  • You understand that software engineering is a team sport.
  • You're passionate about learning and sharing what you've learned.

What we're looking for:

  • 5+ years professional experience as a software engineer.
  • Expertise in modern data engineering, from relational to nosql to big data (streaming and batch).
  • Total comfort with Unix/Linux.
  • Mastery of basic Computer Science fundamentals.

Bonus points for:

  • A 4-year accredited technical degree, or equivalent professional experience (not just a coding bootcamp, please)
  • Experience with NLP, clustering, sentiment analysis, etc.
  • Prior work experience in an agile environment
  • Strong programming skills in a variety of languages
  • Mad skillz with any tech in our stack: Node, Angular, Mongo, AWS, Docker, Kafka, Redshift, etc.
title: Senior Data Engineer

description:
Framebridge is an online custom framing business located in Washington, DC. We are revolutionizing the way people frame their favorite art and photos by making the entire process easy, affordable and hassle-free. Framebridge uses technology to improve the custom framing experience through quick online ordering, lower prices and always-on customer support. Framebridge is a company built on stories. We are lucky enough to frame vintage family photos, marathon race bibs, early product sketches and patents, and baby footprints every single day. We are uniquely positioned to share these stories with an engaged community that’s looking for them. But that’s not all - we have an opportunity to emerge as a thought leader in art, interior design, tech and lifestyle circles, as well.

Job Brief

We are looking for an exceptional Senior Software Engineer who embraces challenges and the opportunity to lead. Your work will be directly responsible for creating consumer-facing products that our consumers love.

We’re a fun and dynamic company, with a team of people who work together on everything from the latest technologies to cutting edge mobile software. You’ll work in our agile engineering group, contributing your expertise to all aspects of our custom framing platform.

Responsibilities

● Create experiences that uniquely allow customers to frame their art, photos and much more.

● Create powerful and easy-to-use features in our consumer-facing products in a secure and scalable manner.

● Create the tools, systems, and processes required to support Framebridge products.

● Help shape our product vision by continuously driving adoption and integration of relevant new technologies into our platform.

● 5+ years experience developing commercial quality web and/or mobile applications.

● Advanced knowledge and proven experience with Rails (or any Ruby MVC framework) and REST (HAL+JSON a nice to have).

● Advanced knowledge of concepts such as security and scalability.

● Advanced knowledge of front-end technologies such as JavaScript/CoffeeScript, HTML, SASS, Angular and responsive design.

● Firm grasp of object oriented analysis and design.

Optional

● Experience with Android and/or iOS (Swift and/or Objective C)
title: Senior Software Engineer

description:
Context

The European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL), one of the highest ranked scientific research organisations in the world, is seeking a highly motivated software developer to join the GBCS team. At GBCS, we use cutting-edge technologies to develop and provide genomics data management and analysis solutions to EMBL scientists (more information available at http://gbcs.embl.de).

Are you a skilled DevOps, eager to learn new technologies, curious about cutting-edge bioscience, willing to work in a flexible, collaborative and international environment? If so, we are waiting for you!

Job Description

The position primarily involves the maintenance and development of emBASE, an EMBL-wide web-based application dedicated to the management of *omics data (e.g. Next Generation Sequencing) produced by the different EMBL research groups. EmBASE uses a client-server architecture using Django with REST API on the server side and a javascript-based GUI based on React-redux technologies. Additional command line UI implemented in Java are developed for advanced users i.e. computational biologists. The successful applicant will also be involved in maintaining analysis server (CentOS) and installing new tools/scientific libraries. She/he is also in charge of supporting users on a daily basis, assembling training materials (e.g. writing of wiki-based documentation/how-to) and organizing tutorials.

Qualifications and Experience

Applicants should have an appropriate university degree in computer science or bioinformatics with 3+ years of relevant experience.

Extensive experience in web application development/deployment with Python/Django (with REST API) and modern web technologies (e.g. Node.js, HTML5/CSS, ReactJS, AngularJS) is a must. Experience in unix server administration, database administration/design and PHP programming are highly desirable. Java programming, unix shell scripting, experience with high performance computing (on clusters), data analysis knowledge with e.g. R/Bioconductor are advantageous. Additional experience with large dataset management and knowledge of bioinformatics would make you the ideal candidate.

The successful applicant will have demonstrated experience using standard software development tools (SCMs, unit/db testing, design patterns, database design, code versioning systems, agile development notions). She/he will be well organized, open-minded, able to work on different projects in parallel, proactive (problem solving skills are essential) and have a user-oriented spirit. The candidate should be able to work independently and also interact well within a team environment. A working knowledge of English is a must.

What we offer

  • The chance to work with leading, cutting edge technologies both in IT and computational biology
  • The opportunity to broaden your skills using open source technologies within a bioinformatics context
  • Development of professional and personal skills
  • The chance to work in one of the highest ranked scientific research organizations in the world and contribute to this joint effort.
  • Working in a young and international environment
  • An initial fixed-term contract of 3 years, renewal up to 9 years
  • Competitive salaries exempt from national taxes, with additional allowances for families and non-residents
  • Assistance for relocation if needed

Should you have further questions, please contact charles.girardot@embl.de.

Additional Information

EMBL is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer offering attractive conditions and benefits appropriate to an international research organisation. Please note that appointments on fixed term contracts can be renewed, depending on circumstances at the time of the review.
title: Software Developer / Bioinformatician

description:
GitHub helps companies and organizations succeed by allowing them to build better software, together. We're looking for a Outside Sales Engineering Manager for the Americas to develop, lead, and mentor our Sales Engineering team in the Americas. The ideal candidate will be passionate about building and developing GitHub's technical sales process and working with various teams to drive customer opportunities.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage GitHub’s Outside Sales Engineering organization for the Americas
  • Coordinate technical sales process and organizational structure
  • Hire and onboard amazing Sales Engineering talent
  • Review performance of and mentor Sales Engineers
  • Provide leadership, development, and training to Sales Engineers
  • Work with product marketing on customer needs and product feedback
  • Work closely with Sales to develop strategic and technical account plans
  • Advocate for market initiatives to drive opportunities
  • Visit customers, partners and represent company at events
  • Manage all aspects of the technical sales cycle including answering technical questions and leading efforts to answer Request for Proposals
  • Lead innovation in trial and demos of GitHub Enterprise

Qualifications:

  • 2-3 years of leadership experience
  • Strong customer orientation, dedication, and passion for delivering a great customer experience
  • Strong presentation skills
  • Great problem solving skills around technical, product, and business questions
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Collaborative and team oriented
  • Interest in Git and GitHub and helping organizations improve and modernize their software development processes
  • Strong technical aptitude and the ability to become deeply fluent in the GitHub's technology and the industry
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Previous Software development, Engineering, or Technical Support experience
  • Knowledge of Git and GitHub workflows
  • High energy and positive attitude
  • Ability to take initiative
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Flexible (ability to work across different time zones) and able to think quickly
  • Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful

About GitHub

WHO WE ARE

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over ten million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

We have a lot of exciting things to do, and we’re looking for the right people to grow with us!

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN

Working at GitHub is, to put it simply, a special slice of the universe. We're committed to transparency, collaboration, experimentation, and always staying classy.

Because of this unique perspective, we've established one of the most flexible and well designed physical workspaces around that encourages you to work as you work best. Right now, over 60% of our employees are based outside of our San Francisco (SOMA) headquarters and work according to how they get their best stuff done.

Ensuring that GitHubbers are healthy, motivated, focused and creative is how GitHub stays awesome. Part of this is ensuring that our benefits* are out of this world.

In a nutshell, we've built and are growing a place where we truly love working, and we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people with many different backgrounds and lifestyles, and we like it that way. We invite applications from people of all stripes. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences that people imagine to discriminate against one another. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate.

*Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask your recruiter!
title: Enterprise Sales Engineering Manager

description:
​About Minted:

Minted is a design marketplace connecting you with the world’s best artists to create something one of a kind. Minted crowdsources graphic design and artwork from a global community of independent artists and sells these as products addressing the $10 billion stationery market, $48 billion art market, and $100 billion home décor market. Minted’s mission is to enable the design independence of both consumers and artists around the world. We aim to build a lasting brand representing the most commercially successful design community in the world.

Combining community with commerce, Minted was founded by a successful serial entrepreneur. Minted is located in a beautiful office in downtown San Francisco and is backed by Benchmark Capital, IDG Ventures SF, Menlo Ventures, and angel investors including Marissa Mayer of Yahoo and Jeremy Stoppelman of Yelp. Minted is comprised of an experienced and entrepreneurial team. We come from Google, Amazon, Microsoft, eBay, Yahoo, and Goldman Sachs and numerous disruptive startups. We are a passionate, creative, ambitious team. Minted is a great opportunity to work with a stellar team and work on a world-changing product, all supported by a proven business model.​

About the Role:

Minted is looking for experienced Full Stack Web Developers to join its Kansas City team. Help Minted build digital products that customers love -- with beautifully designed, delightful, and functional user experiences.

Specific Responsibilities:

Work alongside other developers in the Kansas City team to craft some of Minted’s newest digital experiences and support Minted.com.

Build both frontend and backend application code for products that excel in their design sensibility, user experience, and utility.

Craft interfaces using modern Javascript single-page application frameworks, libraries, architectures, and tools.

Implement the face of Minted as seen by the world and as experienced by customers. Join the Kansas City team in its efforts to make Minted the best place, hands down, for developers to work in KC.

Experience and Skills:

1+ years professional experience with Python

3+ years professional experience with Javascript

Empathy with users and devotion to exceptional user experience

Eagerness to write well-tested, maintainable, and scalable application code

Competence building responsive CSS with a cohesive experience across major browsers and platforms

Rich understanding of details and techniques for delivering an experience to the browser with optimization for page load times

Some familiarity with high-level concepts of modern frontend javascript frameworks (Angular, React, Ember, Backbone, etc)

Comfortable working closely with databases and crafting a strong data model, along with schema migration and form validation

Comfortable working with authentication and authorization systems as well as varied approaches to maintaining application state with sessions, cookies, or other stateful storage mechanisms

Experience building interoperable services with clean APIs for communication

Strong written and verbal skills, proactive communication, plays nicely in a self-managed remote culture

Strong sense of craftsmanship and code quality
title: Web Developer (Full Stack) Kansas City

description:
Park Assist is looking for full stack developers to work on our next generation real-time command and control system.

Who we are:

The engineering team at Park Assist has rescued millions of people from the mundane and aggravating experience of parking in a parking garage. We are a small, agile and energetic team of hardware and software developers who are passionate about making great products and revolutionizing an industry. We're looking for developers who can help us elevate the parking experience even further and who want to have fun in the process.

Who you are:

You are proficient with Ruby, Rails, and JavaScript and you have designed, deployed, and scaled commercial Rails apps before. You have experience with agile development practices and a steadfast belief in the value of testing. You love solving real problems and you're motivated to continuously improve how you do so.

What you will do here:

As a full stack Rails developer, you will work with a small team to build our next generation web platform with interactive dashboards, real-time monitoring and control, advanced analytics and reporting, and complex event processing. You will be involved in every level, including system design, development, and deployment.

How we work:

We plan our two-week sprints in Jira, write documentation in Confluence, and basically live in HipChat. We are agile and pragmatic without being rigid. Our work hours are extremely flexible, and other than a daily 10am stand-up, we keep formal meetings to a minimum. Our technology stack consists of Ruby, Rails, PostgreSQL, jQuery, Bootstrap, Kafka, and Samza, but above all we believe in using the best available tools for a given project and we're not afraid to experiment.

What we are offering:

We provide competitive salary, medical, dental, vision, 401k, flexible vacation policy, whatever equipment you need to do your job well (most of us have macbooks and a couple of displays), and opportunities to attend courses and conferences. Within just a few months at Park Assist you will see your work deployed all over the world (the most gratifying reward, in our opinion). Our office is in NYC (near Grand Central and Penn Station) but we're open to both on-site and remote candidates. Remote employees must be able to come hang out with us every few months (we'll show you a good time, we promise).
title: Full Stack Rails Developer
apply: Please email rails_jobs@parkassist.com to apply. Include your CV and a brief description of a project you've worked on that you're especially proud of. Code samples or link to GitHub account would also be helpful. We will conduct phone screenings followed by a more detailed interview for well qualified candidates.

description:
We are local.ch, Switzerland's official phonebook directory and on our way to become much more than that.

Find out more about the team and the company.

As a web developer you will focus on building apps and creating a great user experience. We develop in Ruby on Rails and Javascript. Our team works with a mix of agile practices, pair programming and code reviews to continuously improve our code and ourselves. We take testing and automation seriously. At local.ch, we believe we have constructed an environment that allows us to continue to adapt and develop cutting edge features.

Your responsibility is end-to-end, from planning, implementation, testing to maintaining your code after deployment. You are part of an experienced team of engineers, working with product owners, specialists and other departments. New features are implemented and deployed in short iterations and your contributions and ideas are always valued.

Since we are running one of the biggest web sites in Switzerland, you get a chance to have a positive impact on millions of users within your first day.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Delight users with great products.
  • Develop web and responsive apps for browsers and tablets.
  • Assist product managers in understanding audience (A/B tests and data analysis).
  • Transform mockups/designs into cross browser web applications.
  • Help us improve the engineering tool chain and process.

Desired Skills & Experience

  • Ideally 3+ years professional experience in web software development
  • Can demonstrate skills in developing rich web applications and user interaction
  • HTML and CSS (HAML/SCSS a plus)
  • Solid Javascript skills
  • Experience with JS frameworks like AngularJS, React, Backbone.js, Ember.js or Meteor
  • Understanding of cross-browser development, testing and bug fixing
  • Experience with Ruby on Rails or similar server-side MVC framework
  • Advanced understanding of HTTP protocol
  • Understanding principles of REST architectures
  • Experience with at least one other programming language as PHP, Python, Go, Java, C++ ...
  • Comfortable at a Unix command-prompt
  • Confidence with using Git
  • Good habits with writing tests (preferably in RSpec and Javascript)
  • Excited by challenging problems, addicted to shipping features to production.
  • Fluent in English. German/French is a plus.

Note: This position requires that candidates are legal to work and live in Switzerland.

Questions?

Questions about the job can be sent directly to the web engineering team lead, Eduard Schäli.
title: Web Developer
apply: Simply send your CV and a link to your GitHub account or code examples to [hrz@local.ch]mailto:hrz@local.ch.

description:
Klinche

is looking for a Fun Energetic and Passionate Project Manager to join our San Jose team. This is a unique opportunity for someone who wants to advance their career and grow their skills.

Who we are

Klinche is leading a new era of Construction e-commerce through our revolutionary multi-party payments platform. By bringing together the entire construction project supply chain into our cloud-based solution, users leverage superior workflow and collaboration tools, and realize unprecedented transparency mitigating the financial, legal, and project risks associated with real estate development. Klinche – the secured payments solution.

Job Summary

Our Product Manager is responsible for product management of current and future Klinche Platforms. The primary role responsibility is for strategic direction, product planning, roadmap creation, execution and adoption of solutions throughout the product development lifecycle.

Job Responsibilities

  • Developing and executing product plans and roadmaps for various Klinche platforms with clear understanding of the market direction, regulatory requirements, technology trends, competition, portfolio management and other variables impacting product strategy.
  • Work closely with several internal stakeholders (e.g. Development, Sales, Marketing, and Client Support).
  • Represent the organization as a Subject Matter Expert, including industry presentations, government and commercial initiatives, client collaboration, prospect events, sales support and other external situations.
  • Collaborate and work with UX/UI team to plan product features with usability in mind.
  • Create, manage and maintain business requirements.
  • Establish appropriate balance between current product and what is needed for the future from a market and profitability perspective.
  • Ensure execution against envisioned product parameters for monitoring product performance, and activity to ensure all aspects of product delivery (e.g. Sales, Implementation, Service and Support).
  • Operate according to organizational best practices and raise concerns identified.
  • Manage all projects, milestones, versions and releases with the Atlassian Toolset (JIRA & Confluence)

Desired Skills and Experience

Required Qualifications

  • Minimum of three (3) years’ Product Management experience.
  • Operational workflow analysis.
  • Create business specifications plans and conduct analysis.
  • Excellent communication skills oral and written.
  • Excellent organizational and multi‐tasking skills.
  • Manage and mentor employees for creation of a strong dynamic team.
  • Manage internal and external client expectations along with conflict resolution.
  • Understanding Agile development practices with the ability to manage expectations and the need to move features in order to ship a product on time
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience.

Desired Qualifications

  • Minimum of seven (7) years’ General Business experience.
  • Fluency in Google Apps (e.g. Documents, Email) and Atlassian suite (e.g. JIRA, Confluence).
  • Real Estate or Construction Information Technology experience.
  • Experience working with a development team and a sales/marketing team to get required features implemented while understanding development complications and timing.
  • Experience working in a startup or entrepreneurial organization.
  • Portfolio demonstrating strong concepts, execution for apps and Web.

Please Send Us A Cover Letter, Resume, and an Example of a Business Requirement You Have Written
title: Product Manager
apply: Email your resume and cover letter to jobs@klinche.com

description:
The Atlantic is a digital-first media company with over 150 years of history and 30 million online visitors a month. We’re looking for a full-stack developer who is passionate about clean code and great journalism and is interested in joining our growing team for full time onsite work at the historic Watergate complex in Washington DC.

Position in Brief: The full-stack developer will write well-documented and maintainable Python, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS code in a team-oriented environment. Responsibilities include maintaining and improving our custom content management system and web platform, and adding and deploying new features to our two websites: TheAtlantic.com and CityLab.com.

Attributes Particular to this Position:

  • Ability to define and communicate a technical vision, possessing excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Familiarity with the Django web framework
  • Ability to translate a design into a working website using HTML5 and CSS3
  • Experience writing complex high performance Python powered websites
  • Experience with GIT version control
  • Knowledge of SQL and relational database design and optimization
  • Comfortable using Linux / Unix command line
  • Strong attention to detail while implementing technical specifications
  • Demonstrated problem-solving skills
  • Minimum of two years fulltime professional experience working with a Python web framework and front end web technologies

Atlantic Media is an EOE of Minorities/Women/Vets/Disability.
title: Full-Stack Python/Django Developer, The Atlantic

description:
